title: oreo needs life saving surgery
Description: Hello everyone!Some of you will know me and some might not, those of you who do, know what Oreo means to me. BIG DETAILSOreo was diagnosed with a rare type of squamous cell carcinoma that is actually operable and he has a fighting chance to survive. Squamous cell carcinoma has a general 1-3 month prognosis, but his, with surgery, could give him 1-3 more YEARS.SMALL DETAILSRight now we live together in Paris as I am finishing up my second year of a masters I embarked on in 2020. Oreo is my rock and my companion. He's been with me since I was 12 years old, we’ve been together for 14 years.COST & TRANSPARENCY DETAILSOur vet who will perform this surgery is Doctor Mihai Guzu who works at ADVETIA vet clinic near Versailles.Our two original diagnostic vet bill came out to 158€ and 988€ (total of just under 1200€). The surgery Oreo will undergo is 3,500-4,000€ without the follow up session or any post-op complications. Thankfully Oreo has an insurance that will cover up to 3,000€ in vet bills, but if we do the math, after the 1,200€ spent on the diagnosis, we are left with 1,800€ for the 4,000€ surgery. Leaving 2,200€ that I will need to pay out of pocket without complications. For this reason, I am setting the fund at 3,000€ as he will likely need post-op appointments that involve scans and the like. Below is an email from the vet, we will have a proper estimate in the coming days.Quote from the vet:*Any excess funds will be donated to other gofundme pages. THE FULL STORYOn November 5th, I took him into the vet after I had noticed some drooling and lack of eating (this is very abnormal, he loves his food). They told me it was an abscess and to give him antibiotics, but to be on the safe side, the vet suggested I take him to a better vet who would do a CT scan of his head to ensure it wasn't a tumor. France being France, the earliest appointment I could get was on the 19th. So off we went on the 19th.I wasn't quite braced for the worst outcome, after 5 hours, the vet said Oreo had 1-3 months to live. As you can imagine, my world was falling apart. I cried for 5 days straight, processing the grief. I know some people won't understand the connection I have with my boy, but frankly the reality of losing him has been worse than losing distant relatives. I always say I live alone, but the truth is, I've never lived alone. He's always by my side. Always waking me up with his yowls for food and his stinky poop. Anywho, he was diagnosed with squamous cell carcinoma. This thing is basically a death sentence.After coming to terms with it, having friends, colleagues and even my boss cry with me, I made peace with Oreo leaving. I made decisions surrounding his death and even bought an urn. After all we have been through together, I knew I gave him the best life I could and loved him as best I could, so saying goodbye felt okay amidst the sea of sadness.On December 4th I had my follow-up appointment to have the vet read me the full biopsy results. I was hoping he'd tell me the death would be sooner rather than later as I didn't want Oreo to have prolonged suffering. After a rollercoaster of a 2 week period, the vet told me that Oreo has a rarer type of Squamous Cell Carcinoma that is not as aggressive as the one most cats get. This means he is actually eligible for surgery to remove the tumor. This surgery is 50/50 though. If they get all the malignant cells out, he can live for 1-3 years (which is great, he’s 14 as it is). If they miss some of the malignant cells, we're back to the 1-3 month prognosis.Oreo is a warrior, this boy has been through it: he fell from the 6th floor when he was 3 and survived, he went missing for 3 months and showed up in a different district to the one we live in (I lived in Miami Beach at the time and he showed up in Hollywood = 17 mile journey). Has had multiple UTI's (deadly for male cats), had 8 teeth removed, lived in 4 countries and 10 different cities. If this is his last of his nine lives, then so be it, but I don't think I could live with myself watching him deteriorate knowing I had a fighting chance. Before I received this news, I had decided I wouldn't fight and told myself I'd let him go, but here is where medical advances and the double edged sword of hope come in and have made me reassess my decision.I think that’s as best as I can summarise the last few weeks and why I am seeking help.Even the tiniest amount of a donation will be incredibly appreciated! I can pay for some of the surgery, but knowing it is about a very expensive surgery and complications could bring it up a notch, I need some financial backing. Thank you in advance for all of your support.~ Oreo + IsabellaRead more

title: siargao relief funding typhoon odette
Description: Our beloved island Siargao, in the Philippines, has been completely destroyed by Typhoon Odette (category 5), on December 16th. The storm was one of the strongest on Earth this year and has swept everything in its path.At this point the communication with the island is still down and we still don’t know if all our friends and family are ok.They have a long way to go to recover but if only you knew how strong and resilient they are..Siargao will be back stronger than ever.It will take months to rebuild, most people will be without roofs over their heads and basic needs.I am calling you today to join hands for the small tear-drop island shaped and its people.We need your help.I am selling my prints for donations :Postcards 15x10cm for 10 -20 euros donation21 x 30 cm for 50 euros donation30 x 42 cm for 100 euros donationI have limited stock for the biggest prints - please contact me.Also, If you have the means, please donate to this page — any amount will help. Donations will be sent to my filipina family and distributed on the ground whenever contact is made again.Thank you so much , Salamat Karajaw et merci du fond du coeur.Read more

title: please help cagdianao dinagat islands philippines
Description: First, let me introduce myself. My name is Gineba Durano Delcourt, 33 years old. I am originally from the Philippines and moved to France to be with my French husband.You probably all heard about the last super typhoon (Odette aka Rai) last Thursday in the Philippines. It actually landed spot on Cagdianao in the Dinagat Islands, where I was born and where my family lives. Just like in Siargao and Surigao city, most buildings were destroyed, small houses were wiped out, electricity, water and signal are still off as of today. Most food stocks were also corrupted by seawater.(Here's an aerial view taken by our Philippines Navy)The government help is prioritized to Surigao and Siargao for now, and any help sent to Dinagat Islands will likely end up in San Jose and blocked from going any further by the damage on the roads.And now according to weather forecast a new tropical storm is heading right there!I desperately want to help the people in Cagdianao.Imagine their situation : no roof to protect you from the rain, no food, no water, no materials to rebuild anything. They are facing dehydration, hunger, sickness from unsafe water, from unsafe food, and from the cold. Not to mention possible looters...My plan is to buy at least sacks of rice (and more depending on the amount i can gather) in Butuan, have it sent to Surigao by truck and then to Cagdianao by boat.(To people who know me, please feel free to PM me on Facebook Gin Durano-Delcourt with different ideas of transport means and items to send, I am open to all options.)Every small gesture will be appreciated.❤️Read more

title: help nusrath for her surgeries
Description: Following my accident on 9th May 2017, I suffered a polytrauma ( a broken ulna, a distal femur fracture and open fracture in tibia). I was hospitalized for 6 months in Jeetoo Hospital and 2 months in Candos Hospital(Mauritius) for my post accident treatment where I underwent nearly over 25 surgeries.Then in 2018 since there was no further treatment for my leg at hospital as there were persisting non union, I started a private treatment with Dr Robert Reymond Rey at Darne clinic where I underwent several surgeries again for uniting the bones. But unfortunately infection and non union persisted where both my hospital doctors and clinic doctor decided to send me abroad for further treatment in September 2019.I went for further treatment in Artemis New Delhi(India),where the first phase of my treatment was done with multiple surgeries. After that the bones finally united. But now to be able to walk again I need to go the second and hopefully last phase of my treatment to be able to walk and be independent.In this journey, God has sent someone for me, a good friend of mine, Mrs Renuka Bissessur, who has created a GoFundme profile where you all will be able to help me worldwide in getting my illizarove surgery done. She is doing the GoFundme collection from my side (she lives in France)as I don't have GoFundme in Mauritius. May God bless her for being a solid support for me at this moment. I humbly request for your help for my surgery as only the surgery will cost approximately 20000 euros(700000 mru ruppees) excluding flight tickets, my stay for 2 months in India (guesthouse), and post surgical treatments such as dressings and home care for injection and antibiotics administration as main expenses.Am due to start my 2nd phase treatment in December 10th 2021.I sincerely hope you will consider my request and accompany me like Mrs Renuka Bissessur in this battle of mobility, a battle to be no more confined to a wheelchair, where my ability to walk back dream will be concrete. Please find attached my documents.Thanking you in anticipationSincerely yours,Nusrath Karrimbuccus - DoomunMrs Bissessur RenukaRead more

title: siargao island emergency found typhoon odette
Description: Chère Communauté, nous avons besoin de vous.Je m'appelle Charity Figuron, et suis native des philippines. Je vis en France depuis 2 ans maintenant, avec mon compagnon et nos 2 enfants.Le 16 Décembre, le Typhon Odette a frappé de plein fouet, l'île de Siargao, aux Philippines, ma chère île, mon chez moi.Ma familles et mes amis qui sont toujours sur place, viennent de vivre un cauchemar. Des vents à plus de 250kmh ont totalement dévasté l'île que nous connaissions.Des vidéos, qui montrent l'ampleur de la catastrophe et des dégâts occasionnés, circulent sur les réseaux sociaux.Mon village que l'on peux voir sur ces images est détruit, la plupart des maisons locales ont été emportées ou éventrées.Ces familles ont un besoin d'aide urgent. Ils n'ont plus de toits dans le meilleur des cas, et ce en saison des pluies.Il va donc falloir réparer et reconstruire dans l'urgence, pour reloger les habitants.Le Typhon à fait tomber 80% des arbres, ce qui signifie qu'il n'y a plus d'ombre et que la chaleur est étouffante.Les aides gouvernementales ne sont toujours pas déployées, de nombreuses initiatives individuelles se mettent donc en place, afin de venir rapidement en aide à la population.Nous savons que l'eau potable et les vivres manquent déjà grandement, désormais le combat est sanitaire, aujourd'hui les premiers décès dus à la déshydratation ont été recensés dans mon village, nous sommes très inquiet.C'est pourquoi nous souhaitons faire appel à votre générosité afin de pouvoir réunir un fond d'urgence pour permettre à nos familles de subsister et d'avoir accès aux ressources de premières nécessitées au plus vite.Si vous souhaitez aider ma famille, vous pouvez m'adresser vos dons, je me charge personnellement de transférer l'argent collecté  auprès des personnes de ma famille.Chaque donation aussi petite soit-elle sera grandement appréciée.Tous les dons serviront à l' achat de première nécessité, eau potable, nourriture, médicaments, et a l'achat de matériaux de construction nécessaires aux réparation des habitations.Read more

title: typhoon odette help roger rebuild his livelihood
Description: My name is Milchie, originally from Guimaras Island in the Philippines, which was hit by Super Typhoon Rai/Odette yesterday. I awoke this morning to the news that my family's livelihood (fish farm and small provision shop) has been washed away. They are left without power and reeling from the impact of the worst storm to hit Guimaras in living memory. Please help me give them hope before Christmas. Your donation, will go a long way in helping them to recover and rebuild their life. Thank you and God bless!Read more

title: philippines odette typhoon december 17
Description: Français & EnglishBonjour à tous, je suis français vivant depuis 4 ans aux Philippines, notre ville de Moalboal à subit les assault des vents de 200 k/h du typhon Rai, nous faisons une collecte de fond pour aider nos voisins & amis qui ont été affecté ce 17 Decembre.Donner, peu importe le montant est déjà une grande aide pour eux. title: aidez terry rebtir sa maison
Description: Hello,We are Jo and Violet Cornu. We are currently raising funds for Terry Asinero, our former Filipino nanny, who took care of us when we lived in Hong Kong about ten years ago.Between December 16 and 18, Typhoon Rai, a force 5 super-typhoon, passed over the Philippines, causing enormous damage to property and costing the lives of at least 375 people. It is the deadliest typhoon of 2021.The typhoon passed through the island of Bohol, exactly where Terry lives, and devastated the house she built herself, and which is her labour of love. The entire second floor collapsed, and her family is now without water, electricity, and resources. Terry's son Arcel, who is a teacher, has lost the computer he needs for remote teaching. Obviously, Covid is adding to their distress.We are raising money to help this person who is dear to our hearts during this critical time. Terry gave us a lot as children and we would like to give back to her. We invite you to participate in this fundraising initiative. We know that Terry is a responsible woman who will be able to manage the money we will be sending her and help those around her who are dear to her, including the members of her parish.Please feel free to share this project and make donations, no matter how small. Every euro helps!Thank you in advance,Jo and VioletBonjour,Nous sommes Jo et Violet Cornu. Nous collectons actuellement des fonds pour Terry Asinero, notre ancienne nounou Philippine, qui s'est occupée de nous lorsque nous habitions à Hong Kong, il y a une dizaine d'années.Entre le 16 et le 18 décembre, le typhon Rai, un super-typhon de force 5, est passé sur les Philippines, causant d'énormes dégâts matériels, et coûtant la vie d'au moins 375 personnes. C'est le typhon le plus meurtrier de 2021.Le typhon a traversé l'île de Bohol, exactement là où vit Terry, et a dévasté la maison qu’elle a construite elle-même, et qui est l’œuvre de sa vie. Le deuxième étage s'est entièrement écroulé, et sa famille se trouve actuellement sans eau, sans électricité, et sans ressources. Arcel, le fils de Terry, qui est enseignant, a perdu l'ordinateur dont il a besoin pour faire cours à distance. Car évidemment, le Covid s'ajoute à leur détresse.Nous collectons de l'argent pour venir en aide à cette personne chère à nos cœurs durant cette période critique. Terry nous a beaucoup donné quand nous étions enfants, et nous voudrions pouvoir lui donner en retour. Nous vous invitons à participer à cette collecte. Nous savons que Terry est une femme responsable, qui saura gérer la somme que nous lui enverrons et aider ceux qui l'entourent et qui lui sont chers, y compris les membres de sa paroisse.N'hésitez pas à partager ce projet et à faire des dons, aussi petits soient-ils. Chaque euro aide !Merci d'avance,Jo et VioletRead more

title: rdr meuf trans
Description: This Group:                           -Pays Ubers or other private transport.      -Is organized by and for Trans Women in Marseille.   -Offers funds towards professional martial arts trainings.-Organizes self defense workshops and de-escalation trainings.Ce group:-Pays Ubers ou autre transport privé.       -Est organisé par et pour Trans Women à Marseille.-Offre des fonds pour des formations professionnelles en arts martiaux. -Organise des ateliers d'autodéfense et des formations de désescalade.                                     More info below Plus du info de suit [EN] In reaction to recent and ongoing incidents of violence against trans women particularly (but not limited to) in the street, different individuals are trying to organize responses aimed at reducing the risks we face through collective organization, awareness and self defense training, and attainment of material resources (such as money for private transport). We don't want trans women to be scared out of or pushed away from participation in public social life, from going to bars, music events, or simply hanging out at night in public space. This topic is a topic which feminism as a concept has historically failed on (with some exceptions) and although we don't expect to overcome the issue- we would like to reduce risk and facilitate equal access to a "normal" social life for trans women in our city (Marseille 13).For reasons of dignity, we ask that people donating make sure to do so anonymously!!![FR] En réaction aux récents et continuels incidents de violence de rue contre les femmes trans (mais sans s'y limiter), différentes personnestentent d'organiser des réponses visant à réduire les risques auxquels nous sommes confrontées à travers l'organisation collective, la sensibilisation et la formation à l'autodéfense, et la recherche et mise en commun de ressources matérielles (comme de l'argent pour le transport privé). Nous ne voulons pas que les femmes trans soient effrayées ou écartées de la participation à la vie sociale publique, d'aller dans des bars, des événements musicaux ou simplement de traverser l'espace public la nuit. C’est un sujet sur lequel le féminisme en tant que concept a historiquement échoué (à quelques exceptions près) et bien que nous ne prévoyions pas de surmonter le problème, nous aimerions réduire les risques et faciliter l'égalité d'accès à une vie sociale "normale" pour les femmes trans de notre ville (Marseille 13).Pour des raisons de dignité, nous demandons aux personnes qui font un don de s'assurer de le faire de manière anonyme!!!Read more

title: redonner le sourire lamia et son fils
Description: Bonjour Aujourd'hui,je veux parler de l'histoire de ma nièce, elle s'appelle lamia, une très belle femme qui vivait une vie paisible, jusqu'au jour où elle décide d'épouser un jeune homme, leur histoire a duré trois mois, son calvaire a commencé juste après leur mariage, il a subi des violences ainsi que son enfant d'une première union de la part de son mari, Elle a décidé de sauver la vie de son fils et la sienne en demandant un divorce, une fois le divorce est prenoncé, son ex mari l'a harcelé. Et le 9 décembre 2021, il e réussi à finir son travail, il l'a suivi et il a tenté de la tuer.J'ai besoin de votre aide pour financer ses opérations chirurgicales ainsi que sa rééducationSans travail et avec un enfant à élever  seule au Maroc n'est pas une tâche facile.Aidez moi svp à lui redonner espoir et un semblant de stabilité pour elle et son enfantMerciRead more

title: justice pour bilel
Description: Bonjour,Nous sommes Maureen et Samia, la compagne actuelle et l'ex-femme de votre ami Bilel Labidi. Nous avons créé cette cagnotte pour que ses amis puissent nous aider à le sortir d'une situation profondément injuste.Le 12 janvier, la police s'est introduite chez Maureen et Bilel d'une force démesurée et a arrêté Bilel pour des charges fausses et mensongères. Il est actuellement incarcéré en attendant son procès le 17 février. D'ici là, nous devons scrupuleusement préparer sa défense avec son avocat. Nous avons vraiment besoin de votre aide pour ce faire.L'injustice de cette situation nous brise le coeur. Comme vous le savez, Bilel est un père dévoué, un ami fidèle et un compagnon aimant. Nous nous battrons pour lui et nous espérons que vous pourrez être à nos côtés. Si vous souhaitez avoir plus d'informations sur la situation, vous pouvez contacter Maureen (06 32 51 76 67) ou Samia (07 81 82 66 97).Avec toute notre gratitude,Maureen + SamiaRead more

title: aidez charlotte
Description: Bonjour à tous suite à un terrible incendie charlotte notre collègue pompiers a perdu toute ses affaires dans l’incendie à travers cette cagnotte nous souhaitons pouvoir lui donnez un petit coup de pouce pour repartir de l’avant.                                                      L’amicale des pompiers de sancoins compte sur vous tous pour être généreux envers charlotte qui le mérite amplement.Read more

title: dzffb prcarit tudiante
Description: Bonjour,Aujourd'hui je crée cette cagnotte car depuis quelques jours, mes parents et moi venont de "rompre". Ces derniers, pour se venger du fait que je me sois déclarer seul à la caf m'ont mit dans une situation financière compliquée. De plus, iels sont transphobes et refuse ma situation, rester avec eux sur les papiers m'empêche donc de transitionner.Pour payer ma mutuelle, pour payer mes courses, ma santé, ect50 centimes, c'est déjà énorme.Sinon, je risque de devoir arrêter mes études et cela va réellement me mettre en précarité et m'enfoncer dans mes troubles psy.J'ai mis un objectif assez aléatoire, je pense obtenir 20€ mais c'est déjà bien.Read more

title: mvvxfc pour mon loulou pendant mon hospitalisation
Description: Les derniers temps ont été un peu compliqués... Accident de voiture qui a généré des frais importants qui nous ont obligés à utiliser toutes nos économies pour la réparer, et me permettre de filer au travail tous les jours pour nous permettre de continuer à vivre notre petite vie ici, en toute simplicité...La télé nous a lâchés peu de temps avant, un impact de foudre à côté de la maison a eu raison d'elle, et nous n'avons pas pu la remplacer... il est vrai que nous vivons bien sans, mais le temps va être long pour Matéo pendant ma prochaine hospitalisation et le mois qui suivra pendant lequel je ne serai pas autorisée à conduire.Le plus rude moralement a été l'annonce de cette 7ème opération de la colonne vertébrale, dans le cadre de cette pathologie dégénérative qui me handicape toujours un peu plus. Une semaine d'hospitalisation après cette lourde opération puis un mois de convalescence compliqué. Les sorties seront limitées, et avoir une télé pour passer ces temps compliqués sera un petit plus, surtout pour mon petit gars de 14 ans qui va devoir vivre ces moments seul, sans la famille pour l'épauler. Si la cagnotte le permet, je souhaiterais pouvoir lui offrir une petite semaine de découverte de la chasse sous-marine ou du surf, rêve qu'il cultive depuis déjà quelques temps...Pas évident de se résoudre à accepter cette suggestion de Matéo de créer une cagnotte en ligne, nous avons toujours eu l'habitude de nous débrouiller pour tout. Mais le temps est trop court pour économiser suffisamment pour arriver à investir dans cette source d'occupation, que je n'adule guère mais qui a son utilité au cours de ce type de période de la vie...Alors pour mon loulou, je m'incline, même si cela m'emplit de gêne...Un grand merci à toi, Sandy, qui m'a inspirée pour trouver cette ultime solution, et surtout un immense merci à tous ceux qui voudront y participer....Read more

title: aide aux habitants de santa fe siargao
Description: Bonjour,C'est avec beaucoup de tristesse que nous regardons ces images de dévastation de cette magnifique île de Siargao suite au passage du typhon Odette(Rai). Nous y avons passé quelques années a côtoyer de merveilleuses personnes qui se retrouvent aujourd'hui sans rien. Le peu qu'ils possédaient, maisons de bois et de tôles ont disparues. Plus d'électricité, d'eau,des débris partout. Ce que nous avions construit à aussi été fortement endommagé,mais je pense surtout à tous ces gens qui n'avaient que quelques euros par jour pour faire vivre leurs familles. Plus d'accès,plus de structures, plus de touristes et donc plus de revenus. Une pensée spéciale pour les habitants de Santa Fe ,petit village de pêcheurs qui fut notre lieu de résidence et ou nous avons gardé amis et familles,que pour le moment nous ne pouvons pas contacter. Chaque euro récolté compte et je salue ici toutes les initiatives déjà prises pour toutes les autres îles touchées par le passage de ce typhon. Merci de votre générositéCathy et YvanRead more

title: aider un frre
Description: Bonjour aujourd’hui on a décidés de mettre en place cette cagnotte pour venir en aide à un frère dans le besoin  Le frère en question est en aveugle mais se débrouillait quand même mais maintenant a cause d’un accident il se retrouve amputé d’une jambe En plus il n’a pas de famille ni d’enfant pour l’aider donc on vous demande de participer le peu que vous pouvez seul Allah pourra vous remercierRead more

title: eviter lamputation
Description: Mon chat disparu depuis un mois est rentré apres avoir été percuté par une voiture, il a du attendre sans manger que sa patte cassée en miettes se consolide suffisemment pour pouvoir rentrer... Les degats sont tels que ppur le faire operer je dois verser 1400€,ou buen pour 400€ je peux le faire amputer de sa patte... Un crève cœur... Je ne ne peux assumer cela... Je vous remercie par avance de votre compassion et sollicitude...Read more

title: soigner mon chat kumo
Description: Bonjour a tous !Voici Kumo, mon petit chat que j’ai eu au mois de mai. Aujourd’hui 14 décembre, je suis rentrer chez moi et je m’attendais à voir mon chat qui m’attendais derrière la porte de mon appartement. Mais contrairement à d’habitude il n’y étais pas. Je l’ai retrouver au milieu de mon salon allonger sur le sol me regardant et miaulant. D’abord étonner de le voir comme ça, j’ai essayé de l’appeler pour qu’il viennent vers moi mais il ne ce levais pas. J’ai donc essayé de l’aider à ce relever, et c’est la que j’ai vu ça patte recroquevillée et toute tremblante. Je l’ai immédiatement emmener chez le vétérinaire.Lors de la consultation, Le vétérinaire m’a expliquer que Kumo devais ce faire opérer de la patte arrière gauche car son tendon d’Achille c’est fracturé.Etant étudiant je n’ai pas les moyen de payer l’opération de Kumo qui s’élève à 850€. Le vétérinaire ma expliquer que si l’on attend trop (1 a 2 semaines) Kumo risquerais d’avoir des séquelles. Je me tourne vers vous pour trouver de l’aide le plus vite possible pour soigner mon Kumo.Meme le plus petit geste est le bienvenue.Merci d’avoir lu c’est ligne et l’aide que vous m’apporterait.Read more

title: aidez le village de batuan se nourrir
Description: Bonjour à tous,je m'appelle Camille Roesch et de Janvier à Mars 2020 je suis parti en voyage aux Philippines.Pendant 3 semaines j'ai été hébergé sur l'île de Bohol, par Jomer Balag, propriétaire de Jolit's Eco Garden, une ferme eco responsable à Batuan, un petit village où tout le monde se connait et s'entraide.Plusieurs familles qui m'ont accueilli comme un ami, un frère, un fils, avec le coeur, sans jamais rien me demander en retour.Mais le 16 Décembre 2021, le typhon Rai a dévasté les Philippines surtout l'île de Bohol, détruisant, les maisons, infrastructures, récoltes.Cela fait donc plusieurs semaines que les habitants se démènent pour trouver de quoi subsister à leurs besoins. La nourriture et l'eau potable se font rares et les prix augmentent. La plupart d'entre eux n'arrivent plus à se nourrir, étant normalement autonomes en légumes et en riz.J'en appelle donc à votre générosité pour aider ces gens qui ont besoin de vous. L'argent sera transféré à Jomer Balag, le responsable de la ferme, qui s'occupera de le dispatcher auprès d'une vingtaine de familles, comme il l'a déjà fait avec un précédent don (photos à l'appui) sous forme de paniers contenants riz, conserves, café, leur permettant de survivre et de se reconstruire en ces temps difficiles.Même un don symbolique de 5€ représente déjà des repas pour plusieurs personnes.N'hésitez pas à partager autour de vous.Un immense merci d'avance.Read more

title: urgent help us save the mighty josephine
Description: Hi everyone,Thank you for taking the time to read the story of the mighty JOSEPHINE and her captain.In advance, I apologize for the personal nature of such a story. I figured if I decide to tell our story, it might as well be the real one.My name is Eric.J.Thazard, I'm forty-three years old, proud father of two wonderful children.Until recently I was an art director and entrepreneur, head of an event production and communication agency. We helped produce many visual campaigns, art exhibitions, advertising films, showrooms, and cultural events for various corporations and governments for the last 15 years.Last winter, despite taking all the precautions and taking my family to the countryside, away from the city, I contracted a severe form of COVID-19. The following months were to be a challenging and life-defining experience for me and my family. For the first time, I realized that I had literally run out of time.After battling the virus for weeks at home I was rushed to the emergency room, unable to breathe or even speak. Once at the hospital, I learned I had to also deal with a bacterial lung infection which combined with the covid virus lead to the partial paralysis of my left arm and leg.In the early stages of the spread, there was no official treatment, no vaccine, hospitals were overrun, a weird sense of panic had taken over. That night I was brought in, 600 people lost their life. Many died away from their loved ones during those early months of the pandemic. I thank and admire the hard work and absolute dedication of the hospital staff on the front line of this epidemic, standing day after day, in dire conditions against COVID 19.After losing nearly a third of my weight (30kg), in total isolation, It is a miracle I survived. I owe them my life.The terrifying thought that I may not see my children grow up if I didn't make it through somehow kept me strangely focused through these difficults moments. I wasn't ready to give up without a fight so I pushed through despite the frightening surreal experience.While recovering and slowly getting back the use of my left arm and leg, as my event business was closed due to the lockdown restrictions, stuck in bed, I had the time to follow the captivating adventures of SV Delos, the old sea dog, Sailing La Vagabonde, Parlay Revival or Project Brupeg, Expedition drenched and others. Memories of the adventures of the Calypso, Captain Jacques Cousteau's legendary marine explorations buried deep after nearly twenty years of frantic city lifestyle came back to me. Childhood flashbacks of Tahiti, Moorea, Cook's bay, Papeete, Port Louis, Mauritius also came back...forcing me to contemplate a different approach to what would be the future, now that I had survived. I began to think about what the next chapter would be.As the summer was setting in, I began to wonder, what would have happened to my family if I had died of covid like so many others. What kind of message, what kind of example, role model would I want to leave to my children before I go? What was I prepared to do with this extra time unexpectedly given? How many people did I really help in my life so far? What did I leave for the next generation? How do I define achievement? Success? I wasn't happy with any of the answers I could find.That summer, in the last days of July, my mother was also rushed to the hospital. Heart attack. As she was living abroad and due to the covid travel restrictions, it took me some 4 days and a 12h flight to get there. She had never met my 5-year-old son James and his 4-year-old sister Louka, her only grandchildren. Something I was planning to fix before covid showed up. She passed away before I landed...On the plane back, after the funeral, I decided to take some time aside from the business and spend more time and energy on useful projects. Useful for everyone and stop wasting precious time.So I co-founded the DOOR INITIATIVE, a non-profit NGO, a marine educational program dedicated to helping children from all over the world discover and care for the Ocean and its wonders. The next step was to find the vessel to host such an initiative. I began to think about a boat able to carry such an educational mission.As I am no wealthy trust fund kid, my family has no corporate foundation, estate castle, or any Panama secret bank account. It was, therefore, crucial to find a realistic project boat that I could afford, a sailboat (wind is free), strong enough (steel or Aluminium), and also potentially large enough to be able to have at least 8 to 10 kids plus crew and educational personnel on board altogether safely and comfortably.Ideally, like it was fate, « she » was the very first boat I visited.JOSEPHINE is a phenomenal and unique 80ft (25m) solid steel maxi sloop built-in 1983/84. Originally designed to please the exclusive needs and desires of a wealthy king passionate about sailing, she has been built to then absolute specs with no limit of budget, equipped with unique and visionary features for its time along with the very best gear money could buy back in 1984.Surprisingly, despite her royal lineage, her days were critically numbered when I found her nearly abandoned in the back of a boatyard in Spain where she had been completely neglected, on the hard for years, on the verge of being scrapped for parts and dismantled after a troubled life.When I saw her perfect Italian lines, robust structural design, stainless steel deck, and her revolutionary hydraulic winged keel, despite her then total state of neglect, I fell in love, passed my captain license, managed to buy the lady for a symbolic price from her previous owner who had nearly given up on the idea of saving her, and decided to dedicate the time and the energy necessary to save this extraordinary vessel from the grim fate the local yard had planned for her, in order to give the both of us a new purpose, for a humane and just cause this time.The objective, once we manage to get her back on the water, through our non-profit, is to be able to welcome the children to our educational adventure program, regardless of their gender, country of origin, race, religion, appearance, abilities, or social background and give them an opportunity, free of any charge to discover, understand, and care for the ocean and its biodiversity. We plan to adapt the beautiful Josephine to be an Oceanic discovery vessel dedicated and equipped to safely have 8 to 10 kids (from 6/12 yers old) on board for missions from 2 weeks, up to one month at a time in residence.School in the morning onboard like any normal class on land, then discovery, exploration, and adventure in the afternoon. We also plan to document this journey on social media, through a Youtube channel in order to document our adventures for all generations and perhaps inspire others to join us in our efforts to protect the Oceans.In order to reach that goal, I ultimately sold all I had left, then legally set up our non-profit organization, and started the lady's rescue. First I was alone, but quickly the project gathered interest, and soon, we had a team of motivated volunteers giving their time and skills whenever they can to help save the big girl. We have the privilege of counting among our volunteers many highly skilled professionals, naval engineers, mechanics, painters, students, videographers, artists, boat lovers, fellow sailors, all making great progress on site trying to save our gorgeous JOSEPHINE.So far we have completely rebuilt and serviced her engine, a powerful 300hp 6 cylinders DOOSAN marine, repaired her ONAN Cummings 17kw generator, and despite having to deal on a daily basis with a very corrupted local boatyard more interested in cash bribery and extortion than helping their clients. We manage non the less to remast her 120ft high aluminum mast and prepared the materials and equipment to weld and repair her steel hull back to insurance requirement.As COVID 19 was bracing for the second wave entering yet another full lockdown, all of Spain and particularly Catalunya where JOSEPHINE is located was completely sealed off, all travels were banned. We lost five months of valuable time, and despite her being located in the center of Barcelona in a supposedly protected in a 24/7 guarded boatyard/marina, we were horrified to find the lady vandalized when we finally managed to get back to her once the travel restrictions were lifted. The marina conveniently pretended they had nothing to do with it.Today, considering COVID-19 multiple lockdowns measures added to the strained relationship with the local boatyard, I find my ability to fully finance JOSEPHINE's rescue by myself seriously altered. I fear that it will be challenging to finance her rescue alone. We have the time, the team of volunteers, the knowledge, and the will to complete her refit but in order to save her now, we need your help.Any support to our cause, even modest is greatly appreciated.If you can not contribute and still care to help us, please share our story on social media, help us grow our online family.Also if you have some time to give us, and you are bold enough to take on some hard work, you are more than welcome to join our team of volunteers as well to help us on-site in Spain, we provide food, beers, and good vibes.You can also support and follow us on social media at https://instagram.com/sv_josephine?r=nametagOur 5 most generous donors will be granted a week onboard JOSEPHINE accompanied by the person of their choice before we start the scholar children admission program, once her refit is completed.Naturally, in full transparency, 100% of your generous donations to our cause will go through our non-profit and be exclusively dedicated to saving the lady. First, we plan to finish welding her hull and reconnect the hydraulic systems to be able to leave the crooked boatyard. Our time and work hours are given as volunteers, so your help will be crucial in helping us cover some of the costs of the high-powered MIG welding station, some safety and navigation gear to be able to get back on the water. Once her hull is welded and we can finally motor JOSEPHINE out of the current complicated yard to her new and SAFE mooring location, only then she will be out of harm's way. We are trying all we can to get there despite the remaining time to be able to stay on-site running out. Providing, with your help, that we manage to save now. We will then properly complete the restoration of her interior, in order to prepare her to welcome the children's educational program aboard safely and plan the first of her many seasons at sea. We are looking at a twelve to eighteen months refit before we can finally have the children onboard and launch our program. We will be partnering with other NGOs specialized in children's assistance long with various primary and high schools around the world to help us in the process. As time is dangerously running out since we barely have a few months left on-site in Barcelona, I decided, following the advice of our volunteers, to launch this fundraising and awareness campaign to support our cause and hopefully with your help definitely save the mighty JOSEPHINE.Should we fail to get her ready on time, despite our relentless efforts since these past 6 months, she will sadly be ceased and destroyedI sincerely believe she deserves a better fate than the scrapyard. She deserves to sail again. Please help us if you can and come sail with us. I humbly thank you for taking the time to read this letter and hope we can count on your support to save a very special lady.Kind regardsEricEric ThazardFounderDOOR INITIATIVE FRANCE10 rue Saint Christophe 77100 MeauxAssociation Loi 1901 - registration 900 486 002Read more

title: atentado terrorista saravenacolombia
Description: Bonjour, je suis Nury, résidente colombienne en France. Je demande à chacun votre coopération dans l'aide des familles qui on été victimes de l’attentat terroriste perpétré par la guérilla colombienne le mercredi 19 janvier 2022 à Saravena en Colombie. Nous cherchons à lever des fonds pour aider les familles afin qu’elles puissent reconstruire leurs maisons qui ont été complètement détruites. La solidarité de chacun d’entre nous fera la différence. Aidez-nous à contribuer. NOUS SOMMES TOUS LA COLOMBIE merci! Good morning, I’m Nury, a Colombian resident in France. I ask everyone for your cooperation in helping the Families who were victims of the terrosist attack perpetrated by the Colombian Guerrilla on Wednesday 19 of January 2022 in Saravena -Colombia. We seek to raise funds to help the victims so that they can rebuild their homes since they were complete destroyed. Even 1 dolar or Eur will make a huge difference to those families The solidarity of all of us makes a difference, help us to help. WE ARE ALL COLOMBIA . thank you! ❤️Buenos días , soy Nury, Colombiana residente en Francia, pido a todos su colaboración para ayudar a las familias víctimas del atentado terrorista perpetrado por la Guerrilla Colombiana el miércoles 19 Enero 2022 en Saravena-Colombia.Buscamos recolectar fondos para ayudar a las damnificados para que puedan reconstruir sus viviendas ya que quedaron completamente destruidas. La solidaridad de todos nosotros hace la diferencia, Ayudanos a Ayudar.TODOS SOMOS COLOMBIA Read more

title: help panglao after typhoon odettes devastation
Description: Last night super typhoon Odette hit our beloved island of Panglao Bohol very very hard. There is devastation everywhere, houses detroyed, roofs ripped, uprooted trees, smashed boats and in the greater Bohol people have lost their lives. The ones who lost the most are the ones who do not have much in the first place, no savings, insurance... there is no electricity on the island, they need potable water, food and money to repair their homes. Many in our neighborhood live from tourism, there has been none for almost 2 years because of the pandemic and they got very little help, only the odd sack of rice... but with their resilience they have managed to live on and now this. With Christmas coming up in one week I hope you can spare 5, 10, 20 euros or whatever you can, it will sure bring many beautiful smiles. I thank you all in advanceRead more

title: help rebuild siargao after typhoon odette
Description: Donderdag 16/12 raasde super-typhoon Odette (Rai) over de Filippijnen. Ons dierbare Siargao bevond zich in het oog van de storm en werd als eerste met volle kracht geraakt. Het eiland is volledig verwoest. Veel van onze vrienden en familie zullen Kerstmis moeten doorbrengen zonder (t)huis (zie foto's). Help ons hen te helpen met fondsen voor dringende noodvoorzieningen (drinkbaar water en voedsel) en de heropbouw van hun huizen.Last Thursday 16/12 super-typhoon Odette (Rai) ravaged the Philippines. It made landfall on our beloved Siargao which found itself in the eye of the storm and got hit full force. The island is completely destroyed. A lot of our friends and family will have to spend Christmass without a home (see pictures). Help us help them with relief funds for urgent emergency supplies (drinking water and food) and the rebuild of their houses.Thanks a lot,Shelyn and FredRead more

title: help siargao island people after typhoon cat 5
Description: SIARGAO FUNDRAINSER. PRINTS FOR DONATION.*plus bas en françaisThursday 16th of December, the Philippines got badly hit by Typhoon Odette / Rai (category 5). Siargao Island (the “most beautiful island in the world”) and its people need our help.People who know me, know the huge place that takes Siargao island in my heart. This island and its people have the same effect on everyone who has been there. 3 years ago now, they brought the biggest joy in my life, they taught me how to live in the moment, and how to appreciate a simple life. I will keep these gifts forever with me, and now I think it’s time to give back to them.The island is 90 % destroyed, there is no more clean water to drink, no more food to feed everyone, still no electricity nor mobile phone reception, which make it harder for helpers to coordinate rescue missions or to know if their loved ones are safe. Houses and even evacuation center have been destroyed so people find themselves without a roof over their head. Imagine yourself or your loved ones, starving, thirsty, without a house, and all of this after two years of struggling because of having no more income due to the Covid crisis.The government hasn’t been giving any help. The first rescue missions have been organised by some resident of Siargao that weren’t on the island during the storm or that managed to escape. All the money we get to help has mostly been coming from fundraiser. The first good news is that most of the people are safe and survived the typhoon, even though it’s been a traumatising moment. The real problem starts now as they find themselves without essential goods as drinkable water, food, and homes. Some people died from illness and dehydration the past couple of days.That’s why I’ve decided to try to reach out to my community. No money is not enough in this case, and if everyone could give just a little, it would go a long way for them. The money will be sent directly to the community so they can start building their houses again and buy basic necessities.For donation over 10 euros, you can choose one of my print in a postal card formatFor donation over 25 euros, you can choose one of my print in 18x24For donation over 50 euros, you can choose one of my print in 30x45Thank you for your help and generosity, it means the world for them and for me.Ella(The images and testimony we have are from people who managed to escape the island, as electricity and signal are still not back there yet).*prints will be sent to you beginning of may 2022, as I am now in a remote area where it is not possible to take care of the printing.________Jeudi 16 décembre, les Philippines ont été gravement touchées par le Typhon Odette (Rai) de catégorie 5. L’Ile de Siargao (élue “’île la plus belle du monde”) et ses habitants ont besoin de notre aide.Ceux qui me connaissent savent la place très importante de Siargao dans mon coeur. Cet endroit et ses habitants ont le même effet sur toutes les personnes y ayant passé du temps. Il y a maintenant 3 ans, ils m’ont apporté tellement de bonheur, m’ont appris comment vivre réellement dans le moment présent, et comment apprécier une vie simple. Je vais garder ces leçons avec moi pour toujours, et je pense qu’il est maintenant temps de leur rendre la pareil.L’ile a été détruite à 90%, il n’y a plus d’eau potable à boire; plus assez de nourriture pour nourrir tout le monde; toujours pas d’électricité ni de réseau, ce qui rend la coordination des missions d’aide encore plus compliquée. Les habitations et même les centres d’évacuation ont été détruits. Tout cela arrive après 2 ans passés sans revenus à cause la crise due au Covid 19, sur une île vivant principalement du tourisme.Le gouvernement n’a donné aucune aide. Les premières missions de secours ont été organisées par certains résidents de Siargao ne se trouvant pas sur l’île au moment où le typhon est arrivé. La plupart des aides ont été financées par l’argent venant de différents fundraiser. La première bonne nouvelle est que la plupart des habitants ont survécus au Typhon, bien que cela ait été un moment très traumatisant. Le réel problème commence maintenant car ils se retrouvent sans biens de première nécessité et certains habitants sont morts ces derniers jours à cause de la déshydratation.C’est pour cela que j’ai décidé de faire appel à vous. Dans ce cas, aucune quantité d’argent est insuffisante, et si tout le monde pouvait donner un petit peu, cela les aiderait énormément. L’argent récolté sera envoyé directement à la communauté, leur permettant de reconstruire leurs maisons et d’acheter des biens de première nécessités.Pour une donation de plus de 10 euros, vous pouvez choisir un de mes tirages en format carte postalePour une donation de plus de 25 euros, vous pouvez choisir un de mes tirages en 18x24Pour une donation de plus de 50 euros, vous pouvez choisir un de mes tirages en 30x45Merci pour votre aide et générosité; cela signifie beaucoup pour eux ainsi que pour moi.Ella                                                                               these are the photos available for printsRead more

title: naturalborntravellers
Description: https://gofund.me/e966008bHi allWe live in this truck and have been stuck in Corsica way more than a year now.Our batteries (2x180ha = or 2x180 € minimum) were stolen from us. Life is very hard here with physical injuries as well. So not been able to work, means that our economy have gone up in smoke. The truck will not moving without the batteries and that also means our lives are at a stand still for more than a year, there are other costs like the boat to the mainland 800 euro and gasolina, just reaching the mainland would help us a lot in the direction we want to go in life with work from to just live and continue our life. with more oportunities than on this island. where we can join the customers who are waiting for me all over Europe again.Embarrassed to have to ask, but we are at the end of the rope. Thanks ahead for any help ♥️♥️♥️Read more

title: jellysmack for lebanon
Description: There's an unprecedented crisis in Lebanon. Weekly grocery bills can equal months of a typical family's income. Banks are refusing to let people withdraw money. Basic medicines are often unavailable, and gas-station lines can last hours. Every day, many homes lack electricity.Lebanon is enduring a humanitarian catastrophe created by a financial meltdown. The World Bank has called it one of the worst financial crises in centuries.Jellysmack's Affinity Group "Jellybanese" is organizing a special event in our Paris Offices to create awareness. But also to ask for help from our Jellysmackers to bring some products and medicine shipped to Lebanon.They're also starting this funding campaign and counting on everyone's solidarity.Read more

title: dmnagement des filles
Description: Je m’appelle Stefani. Je suis une jeune immigrante brésilienne vivant en France, je donne des ateliers d’arts plastiques pour les enfants dans les écoles primaires à Saint-Ouen, ville où je vis depuis 6 ans, quand je suis arrivée en France. Actuellement j’y vis avec ma fille Pandora qui a 3 ans et est née ici. Je l’élève toute seule depuis que j’ai été abandonnée par son père lorsqu’elle n’avait que quelques mois et depuis, je suis la seule gestionnaire de notre foyer.Ma situation financière est critique ça fait des années mais les dernier 6 mois ça s’est empiré suite au complet abandon financier du père de Pandora qui a arrêté d’envoyer les seuls 150€ qu’il nous envoyait par mois. J’ai besoin de votre aide pour la situation suivante : La propriétaire de notre logement actuel va vendre son appartement et on a dépassé la date définie par le préavis depuis décembre. Depuis des mois j’ai entamé une recherche de logement, et j’ai mon dossier refusé chaque fois pour manque d’une situation financière stable.Il se trouve que j’ai finalement trouvé un appartement, et je déménage le vendredi prochain. J’ai besoin de votre aide financière EN URGENCE pour :La caution (1000€)Les frais d’agence (550€)Le démenagement (loyer camionette 100€) ;Acheter une machine à laver, une plaque de cuisson, et un petit frigo 250€) .On n’a pas beaucoup de meubles mais on va se débrouiller sans ça dans un premier moment, le déménagement est le plus important maintenant.On compte sur vous pour nous aider, n’hésitez pas à faire tourner la cagnotte. Nous vous remercierons éternellement.Bisous d’amour,Stefani et PandoraRead more

title: typhoon odette together lets help siargao
Description: On December 16th, a category 5 typhoon hit Siargao, Philippines, devastating most of the island and its houses. The inhabitants were left without electricity, water, food and medicine, facing a major humanitarian crisis.The Baybayin Library team has been mobilizing since day one to respond to the emergency alongside its local partners. Most of the aid that arrived on the island following the passage of the typhoon was the result of the mobilization of local NGOs, volunteers and private donors. An unprecedented mobilization in the face of the calamity that was played out on the island and the absence of international NGOs.Today, many families are without housing, in the middle of the rainy season. Food distributions continue but it is becoming urgent to rebuild homes and implement various projects for the development of the island.The Baybayin Library, our French NGO, needs your help to carry out its actions on the ground!For this year 2022, our mission will focus on three main actions:1. Library opening:After two years of construction and an opening postponed numerous times due to the pandemic, our nonprofit library was ready to open in early January. Unfortunately, the typhoon damaged our building, especially the roof. Our members on the ground made the choice to renovate the building as soon as possible in order to open our doors to the children of General Luna. We want, more than ever, to offer them a warm and welcoming place where they can have fun and recover from the trauma they have experienced. Two animators will supervise the children and will offer them numerous activities such as creative workshops, storytelling and cartoon screenings. We will be accompanied by psychologists in order to provide the most effective support to our visitors.2. Food distribution and reconstruction assistance:Our mission is evolving and our team is adapting to help the local population. Our members organize food distributions, relief missions and help rebuild homes. As soon as the library opens, our team will serve free meals for the children.3. Participation in development projects:In partnership with local NGOs, the Baybayin Library wishes to participate in the financing of various projects aimed at redeveloping the local economy. Sponsorship of farms, financing of materials for the reconstruction of fishing boats, financing of solidarity canteens for children or assistance with access to care are among the many essential projects supported by our NGO.Thanks to your support, we will be able to perpetuate our actions in the ground and participate actively in the development projects dedicated to the inhabitants of Siargao.NB: Our website is currently being updated. To follow our actions on the ground, we invite you to visit our Facebook page @BaybayinLibrarySiargao and our Instagram page @baybayinlibrary_generalluna !Thank you very much for your help!Read more

title: aidez ma mre suite au dcs de sa compagne
Description: BonjourLe 19 janvier 2022, ma mère a perdu brutalement sa compagne depuis 35 ans.Marie-Renée avait 66 ans lorsqu’elle est décédée du Covid après quelques jours dans le coma en réanimation.Ma mère est en difficultés pour payer les frais d’obsèques et elle va devoir quitter le logement qu’elle occupe trop cher maintenant qu’elle se retrouve seule et se reloger.Vos dons seront reversés directement sur le compte de ma mère. title: typhoon rai did this please help

title: help emiline a victim of fraud
Description: Hello, My name is Emiline and last's night I was the victim of a fraud that cost me 2.658,15 euros. Unfortunately, this fraud is legal and cannot do anything. So, let me explain to you what happened. While I was going to the climbing gym I lost my keys. I realized it pretty soon and came back to my building and called a locksmith. He told me that it would be 29 euros to come and 65 euros for the intervention. I thought:  'Fine, I'll get away with this with less than a hundred euros, I'll try to spend less money this month'.However, when the worker arrived he told me that it was a reinforced door and that it would cost me approximately 350 euros. Things were only starting to get worse.He successfully opened the door by creating a hole in it, but,  as soon as he entered the apartment he said that he broke the security system and we needed to replace the system, a thing that will cost 2.000 euros.In the end, I had to pay 2.658,15 euros which is insanely high for me as I am a student. To pay for this, I had to use my savings and my parent's savings that were supposed to pay the end of my diploma. So, It is a bit difficult but today I am asking you if you could help me a little to reimburse my parents and pay for my studies. Thank you so much for your contribution. I will be forever grateful for your help. Read more

title: help a chechen gay save his life
Description: Hi, I was forced to open this collection of money, because I no longer see any other way out. My name is Adam (Name changed for privacy reasons), I am Chechen. Since 2017, I have lost a lot of friends who were killed by the authorities of the Chechen Republic. Since 2017, I have been engaged in "underground" human rights activities, I have my own community, the largest Caucasian LGBT community in the Vkontakte social network. Guys from the Caucasian republics (mainly from Chechnya) wrote to us there and we helped them to go to a safe place and save their lives. We connected them with the Russian LGBT network, sometimes with our own money and risking our safety, we helped them to make the necessary documents and take them out of the region. By some miracle, for several years my name did not appear on the "lists" that were compiled by Chechen security forces, despite the fact that Kadyrov and his entourage knew very well about this community and even now they are watching us. But in September 2020, I was caught in Moscow and taken to Grozny, where I was placed in a "torture prison". They kept me there for almost 3 weeks, forcing me to tell the names of Chechen gays I know. They were beaten, not given food, water, forced to stand in one place for 10 hours and bullied. When they realized that there was no point in keeping me there any longer, they demanded money from my family in exchange for my life. Pass me on to my relatives so that they decide for themselves what to do with me and how to "wash away the shame from the surname." My uncle agreed to pay the required amount and wanted to deal with me himself (he could have killed me, he always hated me). In Chechnya, this is common when relatives themselves get rid of their gay and lesbian children to get rid of the shame. But my mother and the Russian LGBT organization saved me. Mom stole my passport from my father, and late at night on September 23, I left for Moscow. I was temporarily hidden there and we started looking for ways for me to leave Russia. They started looking for me as soon as they found out that I had escaped. I changed 8 cities in Russia, was constantly on the run. All this time, LGBT organizations helped me and I was not alone. I could not get a visa, European embassies refuse immediately if they see in the passport that a person is from Chechnya. I could not find a way and a way to leave Russia for Europe, for several months I tried and searched for different options, tried to fly from Kiev, from Tbilisi, I was not put on a flight, due to the fact that they think I will request asylum in a transit country (for a transit flight, a Schengen visa is not needed, and I tried several times to fly to a visa-free country for Russians with a transfer in Europe, but I was denied boarding a plane). In March 2021, I was attacked by Chechens in St. Petersburg, but I managed to escape from them, helped by people who were on the street (photos taken after the attack in St. Petersburg, I did not have a photo from Grozny)And I decided to fly to Georgia right away. All this time I did not stop working with my group and helping the Chechens, which angered the Chechen security forces even more. When I arrived in Georgia, I temporarily restricted any contacts with anyone and stopped helping. My psyche could not stand it, I tried to end my life. My location in Tbilisi became known once, and they tried to take me to Russia. But there are excellent police in Georgia and they helped me. I moved to another city in Georgia and resumed my search for a way to fly to Europe and started working with the band and helping Chechens again. In June, I was forced to leave for Turkey because it was not safe for me to stay in Georgia. Chechens have too many connections in Georgia and could find me again. Now I am in Turkey, my location, thank God, is still unknown to anyone, I continue to do my job and help people, friends, organizations help me, and I did not stay on the street, but it is also unsafe for me to stay in Turkey. I found a way to get to Europe, but I need money for that. I do not know the exact amount, perhaps it is even more than the one I will ask for on this site. This is my last chance to find the money to finally be safe.Read more

title: aidez ruwan rparer son van
Description: Bonjour,Je lance cette cagnotte afin d'aider Ruwan, chauffeur privé au Sri Lanka qui a eu un accident important qui le prive de son van et donc de travail.Je précise que l'accident n'est pas du fait de Ruwan qui est très prudent.L'assurance ne prend pas en charge la totalité des réparations ni la perte de revenus.Cette aide lui permettra de reprendre rapidement la route et ainsi de faire découvrir aux touristes les trésors du Sri LankaRead more

title: collecte de fonds pour le typhon odette
Description: Bonjour Mes Amis, Je viens vers vous, car.. Vous l'avez surement entendu, apperçus dans les médias ou autres, Après que le typhon Odette (nom international Rai) a provoqué des destructions massives aux Philippines le 16 décembre, les besoins des enfants et des familles dans les zones touchées deviennent urgents. D'après les premières évaluations, environ 845 000 enfants ont besoin d'une aide d'urgence. Les besoins immédiats comprennent de la nourriture, de l'eau, des médicaments, des vêtements... Nous nous tournons vers l'idée de solidarité au délà des frontières, en rédigeant ce texte à ce jour, j'ai personnellement la moitié de ma famille, sur le sol de Cebu aux coeur du passage du Typhon, cottoyant quotidiennement les personnes les plus démunis, et finances personnellement une aide pour la nourriture et la reconstruction des habitats.. Donc aujourd'hui après constat de l'épuisement rapide de nos ressources humaines, financières, et vitale, il est nécessaire pour nous, de se tourner vers une collecte de fonds à petits budget et grande échelle internationale.- A qui cette collecte est-elle déstiné ? : Nous recoltons l'argent par Facebook qui sera immédiatement reversé aux personnes les plus touchées de mon entourage.- A quoi les fonds serviront ? : Reconstruction des habitats, achats de nourriture et d'eau potable. (Il est actuellement difficile de se procurer de l'eau potable, par conséquent, les prix ont doublé voire triplé).Read more

title: slowly building towards a better future
Description: Hello, how are you? My name is Rakuen, also known as Max from my real name, and today I decided to set a GoFundme to help someone I deeply care about. They recently attempted suicide and unfortunately, right as we were about to start on working on things to make everything better and possibly get the both of us move some place peaceful where we could take time to relax, the last straw breaking the camel's back happened, and the both of us had to definitely cut ties with our families, for they did something unforgivable after years of psychological abuse they don't feel responsible for. The person I'm taking care off is really sick, she has two cancers stage one that have been found out very early, so she's doing somewhat well, but has led such a difficult life that she's been finding herself unable to be social and to enjoy anything due to crushing depression, among other things. Fortunately, while it seems she's doing well enough for the time being, a number of things bother me. Apparently, the default GoFundMe money asked by most people is about $1000, which is what I decided to put, although I originally only had in mind no more than $300, mostly since I know we all struggle with money. If the goal is met (and by that I originally meant the $300 but any extra is more than welcome), my plans to use the money are as follows:First, I would like to buy her an oxygen tank. These are expensive here but very useful, and if I could help her sleep better in any way through that, I would be delighted. Second, the picture I set for the GoFundMe banner is medicine that is extremely hard to come by, although fortunately not too expensive, but it works wonders on her to calm her down for some time, to sleep well and to forget her issues, and I would like to buy some form time to time to help her, until she can confidently tell me one day she doesn't need them anymore. And last but not all, life on her end has been so difficult since last year and in the recent month I found out nothing makes her happy anymore. Depression is too strong for her to even want to eat or to do anything, but the one thing that makes her react is when I talk to her about her characters and the things she likes to write about. Naturally, this comes last because buying art for her with money donated by other is more than an insulting outrage, but I would be delighted to be able to offer her something and to see her smile from genuine happiness, if ever possible at all. I would like people to know I will never resort to this despite receiving money if it only feels like I'm wasting it. Her health with always have priority. I think all has been said, regardless of what's going to come out of this, I hope and I hope it might work out, even if it's just a little. Once again, thanks to the people who were there for her while I couldn't be, and please, pay attention to your loved ones. Even the ones who look like they're doing well might need help. Thank you!Read more

title: cagnotte mario protection de lenfant
Description: Hello family and friends,I am reaching out for help as a survivor of domestic violence in front of our son at the hands of my ex husband. Thank you for all your support.Liane WilliamsonRead more

title: rebuilding chief mau tribe members homes
Description: The typhoon Odette may have passed but the destruction it caused still remains. As rain and winds pour over our hometown again some of our members still have no roofs over their heads. It is time to help them rebuild.Through initial donations we were able to distribute basic essentials to a total of 91 families in our community. And now we wish to focus our efforts in helping our tribe rebuild as the rainy season can last until March and shelter is a necessity our people badly need at the moment.We thank you for taking the time and interest in this cause and hope for your support.Updated and full transparency report may be viewed through this link https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1vEB1F283QBrGUq4_U_i8fTSm5Mr-LXcB/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=106517762610594497318&rtpof=true&sd=trueRead more

title: soutenons maia notre communaut inner dance
Description: Il y a quelques jours, le typhon Odette a dévasté certaines parties des Philippines, dont Palawan, l’ile qui a donné naissance a l’inner danceMaia ou vit Pi, le fondateur de la communauté/ecovillage d’inner dance, a été durement touché, tout est quasiment détruitPres de Puerto Princessa ou vivent Daniw (la personne qui au côté de Pi avait fondé Maia et Bahay Kalipay) et ses enfants (Pi est leur papa) , la situation est traumatique…Depuis que je les ai rencontré il y a maintenant près d’une dizaine d’année, ces personnes n’ont cessé de partager leur sagesse, de soutenir les villages philippins au travers des programmes alimentaires, professionnels, educationnelsContribuons a les soutenir pour que très vite cette épreuve ne soit plus qu’un souvenir !L’ensemble des fonds récoltés ira directement a la communauté Maia pour reconstruire l’ecovillage et la maison de Daniw. Pi gerera les fonds et aidera aussi les pecheurs de la plage avoisinante qui ont tout perdu, y compris leur petit bateau, leur outil de travailMerci pour votre soutien et votre contribution Read more

title: un incendie nous ravage avant larriv dun bb
Description: Bonjour Je suis profondement désastré par cet incident qui a ravagé mon studio , celui de mon pere et notre restaurant ....le feu à prit vers 9 heure du matin au Moule en Guadeloupe situé en bord de mer et malheureusement le feu a fait ravage sur cet endroit magnifique .....ma conjointe me dit que ca sent le feu.... Elle , etant enceinte a l'odorat super developpé donc sur le moment je decide de lui faire confiance et en rentrant dans le studio de mon pere je vois son salon en train de fumer , une flamme aussi geante que moi et mes 1m 90 ! j'ai eu si peur .... ma cousine qui netait pas loin de moi avait un extincteur dans son entreprise et me l' a passé , malgré ca je nai pas pu calmer le feu je l'ai meme amplifié malheureusement ..... Voila la cause de mon desarroi : de ne pas avoir pu eteindre ce feu alors quil netait qu'au debut . et puis là ce fut l'effet domino . Le studio de mon pere prit feu , le mien en fumée , et le restaurant pour finir . le resultat netait que des cendres .... des années d'acharnements... Entre materiel pro de cuisine et objets personnel de famille , d'enfance , de valeur tout avait disparu. Ma conjointe ayant respiré de la fumée et fragilisée par sa grossesse avait fini cet episode aux urgences. Ce mardi fut le pire jour de ma vie jusquà present . Mais en meme temps ce jour me motive pour le reste a venir, Objectif : Tout reconstruire et creer mieux . je pense que tout est dit ..... ma motivation demeure plus grande et grace à votre aide je saurai vous accueuillir dans cette espace une fois reconstruit et vous en etre reconnaissant de mavoir aidé.Read more

title: lart est compense
Description: Bonjour ou Bonsoir , je m'appelle johone ,je fait des Graffiti  depuis 1992 ,je paye aussi des impôts..et respect tout le monde  .j'aime voyager ,j'aime la vie ,les couleurs les odeurs ,la Faune et la Flore.Arreté Dernièrement pour avoir peint un métro ..(oui un métro..,car il y a toute une culture derrière cela qui s'appelle Hip-hop ! Et pour tout ceux à qui ça choquerait..je vous invite à Consulter et laisser vos yeux ce plonger dans le Livre "SUBWAY ART"Œuvre de Martha Cooper et Henry Chalfant pour vous y faire une idée plus positive l'ideé et de construire une cagnotte, ensemble , et de développer une Exposition photo en faisant Hommage à ces peintres écrivain.Chaque photo seront vendu dans le cadre de régler nos actions à connotation messagère mais punie par la Loi et permettrons dans un futur de développer des actions pour les sans abris.cela peut paraître ambigu ou tordu mais c'est un art à Suivre...chaque personne sensibilisé par ce projet et déjà dans la contribution de l'histoire..,d'un mouvement..,d'une culture...qui est le Hip-hop je vous remerci d'avoir prit le temps de me lire en vous souhaitant le meilleur.Read more

title: passionn de voiture
Description: Je collecte des fonds pour mon petit frère qui a eu un accident de voiture à cause d’un homme qui n’était pas prudent sur la route.Mon frère a 20 ans c’est sa première voiture qu’il a financer seul. Mon frère a effectuer énormément de modifications que je ne saurais énumérer car je n’y connais rien..Mais j’ai vu les jours, les mois, l’énergie, l’envie qu’il a passé sur cette voiture, pour que tout partent en fumé a cause d’une personne.Il avait commencé à la préparer pour qu’elle aille sur piste.Malheureusement l’assurance ne donne pas grand chose car tout ce qu’il a modifié et payer n’est pas pris en charge par l’assurance.Aujourd’hui il ne souhaite pas en acheter une autre car il souhaite la réparer, on y croit !Mais malheureusement mes parents et moi n’avons pas toute cette argent pour financer la totalité de cela.Le véhicule est très endommagé, il demande beaucoup de réparation que nous ne pouvons financer..C’est pour ça que’ aujourd’hui nous souhaitons ouvrir une cagnotte.Nous vous remercions de tout cœur.Read more

title: aidez ma maman surmonter les preuves
Description: Bonjour je m’appelle julianne Mancini j’ai 14 ans et je souhaiterais aider ma maman à surmonter les épreuves.Tout à commencer en 2017 quand sa maman et morte,elle n’a pas pu aller à son enterrement ni lui dire au revoir.En 2018 ma maman c’est fait opéré de la vésicule biliaire et elle as faillit mourir.En 2019 elle c’est refait opéré des cervicales elle aurait pu être paralysée.En 2020 elle c’est re refait opéré des lombaires.Et en 2021 le 4 octobre ma maman c’est refait opéré du prolongement de l’arthrodese de 2019.Maman à une santé très fragile,sans compter tout les soucie du quotidien qu’elle doit géré seule avec 5enfant .Nous avons très peu de resources,pour faire face a tout ça.Je compte la générosité des gens pour nous venir en aide.Merci de votre compréhension.⚠️ATTENTION CECI N’EST EN AUCUN CAS UN MENSONGE POUR DÉTOURNER DE L’ARGENT.Read more

title: help our flood victims by donating
Description: Hi,On behalf of our colleagues, I am raising a donation for 2 of our employees affected by the flood disaster in Klang, Selangor, Malaysia on 18th December 2021.Your donation will be paid to the beneficiaries so that they can replace their damaged furniture and electrical appliances and also do some repair jobs in their house.Your kindness is much appreciated.Thank you.Read more

title: shelter for siargao
Description: We appeal to the generosity of people for Siargao's recovery. What happened? On the 16th of December, Typhoon Odette destroyed Siargao Island leaving 90% of its inhabitants with no home. In the midst of the rainy season, shelter is one of the current challenges locals are facing while trying to regain their livelihood.Who are we?We are individuals who experienced the typhoon and witnessed how tragic the effects were to the island locals and especially their livelihood. We decided to give back to the community that took care of and fed us during and after the typhoon.That's why we decided to raise this GoFundMe initiative because we couldn't just do it ourselves, we ask for your help to rebuild the glory of Siargao Island and be a glimmer of hope to the locals, continuing the legacy of Bayanihan. "Bayanihan" - used to refer to a spirit of communal unity and cooperation.Our main goalWe want to provide materials to rebuild 100 local homes destroyed by Typhoon Odette in Siargao Island.Our approachProvide local homes with corrugated metal sheets, plywood, tools, solar lights, and other necessary materials to rebuild with.Shelter kitThe components of the shelter kits have been proposed by architects at DPWH and master carpenters.LogisticsOther expensesFundraising & financial fees: 45,000 PHP (800 €)Miscellaneous expenses: PHP 30,000 (€ 500)Gross totalMaterials for 100 homes: 900,000 PHP (15,600 €)Logistics & warehousing: 100,000 PHP (1,750 €)Other expenses: 75,000 PHP (1300 €)TOTAL TO COLLECT: 1,075,000 PHP (18,650 €)Before launching this page, we already collected 97,493.50 PHP (1,689.23 €).When? Our goal is to send the first batch we need by the 1st week of February 2022.For full transparency, we will send updates to all donors.Read more

title: typhon raiodette soutien siargao island
Description: SOLIDARITE! Le typhon Rai/Odette de catégorie 5 (maximale) a touché les Philippines jeudi dernier (16/12/21).Plus de 400 000 personnes ont du fuir leur domicile. Le bilan humain est encore incertain. Les dégâts sont importants, certaines régions ont été rasées.Les habitants se retrouvent dans des conditions préoccupantes, ils n'ont plus d'eau potable, plus d'électricité, plus de nourriture, de toits... Alors que la population connaît déjà une grande précarité, accentuée par la crise covid.Les Philippines sont extrêmement vulnérables aux catastrophes naturelles, les typhons sont de plus en plus violents, à mesure que le changement climatique provoqué par l’homme s’accélère. Chaque année une vingtaine de typhons détruisent des habitations, les récoltes et les infrastructures.Plusieurs îles ont été touchées par cette dernière catastrophe, Surigao, Dinagat, Leyte, Bohol, Cebu, Negros, Palawan... Siargao est l'une d'elles et, parce qu'elle est située dans le Pacifique, elle a été frappée de plein fouet. C'est une île sur laquelle il y a peu de temps j'ai rencontré des personnes très précieuses à mes yeux et à mon coeur. Aujourd'hui ces amis philippins s'entraident et se mobilisent sur place pour aider les plus démunis. Dans l'urgence ils viennent de rassembler, d'acheminer et de distribuer de l'eau et de la nourriture mais cela n'est suffisant que pour quelques jours. Ils ont besoin de quoi reconstruire leurs maisons, dégager les arbres tombés, les débris, les ruines et les routes, de quoi filtrer l'eau, s'éclairer (il faudra au moins 6 mois avant de pouvoir de nouveau avoir de l'électricité), il leur faut des outils, des médicaments (contre la déshydratation et la diarrhée notamment), et plus de riz.Les philippins sont à mes yeux un modèle en terme de générosité, de solidarité et de résilience. Si vous souhaitez les soutenir, vous pouvez participer à cette cagnotte. Chaque don est versé aux locaux, présents sur le terrain.Soyons nous aussi solidaires et ne nous mettons pas des œillères sur ce qui se passe autour de nous, que ça soit à l'autre bout du monde ou proche de chez nous. J'encourage tout le monde à faire quelque chose, ce qu'il peut, pour cette cause là, ou pour une autre.A ceux qui ont lu ce post en entier merci beaucoup! Vous pouvez aussi le partager (si vous le voulez). Salamat karajaw!Read more

title: typhoon rai victims need you
Description: Hello i am Framie from Philippines living in France. I am a private individual who is willing to help my fellowmen in Surigao, Southern Philippines who were victims of super typhoon rai that hit the area last December 16,2021. Where lots of people lost their homes and their source of living. And my little effort might be a big help for those in need. In the begginning i doubt to organize a fund raising because i am shy to ask favors from others. But if i don't do anything, how can i help the needy. And i realized there is no shame in helping others that is why i am knocking on your generous heart to ask maybe you have a little amount of money to share. And the money collected will be withdrawn  and send to the philippines via remittance center and be use to buy sacks of rice to be shared among those in need and some tin sheets for them to have at least a roof. I will ask my son to do the tasks for me. And everything will be documented. We planned to dessiminate the items we have to the residents in the community of San Juan, Washington and Cantiasay. The small amount could make others continue to live their lives..I would like to thank you in advance for your kindness..FramieRead more

title: pour soutenir jorge
Description: Bonjour,Comme vous le savez peut-être, Jorge a été placé en détention provisoire.Je fais mon maximum pour l’aider, et je me suis dit qu’il aura en premier besoin de financer sa défense.Je fais donc appel à votre amitié pour Jorge et à votre générosité, pour nous aider à payer les frais de justice et tout autre frais induit par cette affaire.Il sera très touché par votre soutien dans cette épreuve douloureuse.Merci pour nous deuxZoéRead more
