title: canadians for clean water
Description: If anyone can raise $5 million dollars in one week it should be all Canadians who believe that clean drinking water for Indigenous communities should be our nation's top priority.Let's use our frustration, our anger, our disappointment but also our hope and our love for our beautiful country and show the government and the world what Canadians are capable of.We need to share this fundraiser widely and quickly! Every single moment and dollar counts.All funds raised go directly to Water First, an organization that partners with Indigenous communities to support access to clean drinking water through education, training and meaningful collaboration. Gofundme will directly send the funds to the organization through Paypal.Registered Name: Water First Education and Training Inc. / L'Eau d'Abord Éducation et Formation IBusiness No: 838525269RR0001Gofundme would like me to explain how I'm related to the person(s) we are raising funds for: I'm simply a Canadian citizen who believes in the basic human right to clean water and who also believes in the power of a nation to fundraise for a cause. The funds will all be spent by Water First on their education, training and collaborative efforts directly with the Indigenous communities they work with. www.waterfirst.ngoRead more

title: support ksar ongoing operations
Description: The Kabul Small Animal Rescue will keep its doors open after our upcoming mammoth evacuation, and will need your continued support to do so. Our mission in Afghanistan is simple: help any animal in need to the best of our ability. This includes pets, stray animals, and working dogs, regardless of owners. Funds will go towards food, medicine, animal transportation, in country staff salaries and benefits (including food and medical aid), facility rentals and upkeep, equipment costs, utilities, and toys. We will stay open for as long as it is safe and we have the means to do so.We will rehome all our rescues outside of the country for the foreseeable future, so the many animals in our care that are too young for this flight or that we haven't had long enough to put on the flight list will be transported, ideally on commercial flights.Every day we get orphaned, sick, injured, or needy animals dropped at our door or called in, and we will respond to the best of our abilities.Please consider a small donation to this fund to support the ongoing operations of KSAR or sharing this with your friends and family.Read more

title: help the family of fallen fireman kenny lacayo
Description: Firefighter/Paramedic Kenny Lacayo made the ultimate sacrifice while operating at an early morning house fire in Baltimore City on January 24, 2022.Kenny began his firefighting career as a volunteer at the Rescue Squad in May of 2011 and steadily advanced through the ranks. He became a firefighter in 2012, a paramedic in 2014, and a founding member of the Honor Guard in 2017. Among his many awards, Kenny received the Rescue Squad’s award for paramedic of the year in 2016 and was recognized as a top ten responder in 2015 and 2016. He also received a unit citation in 2018 for his life-saving actions in responding to a pedestrian struck by a car.His exceptional skills as a firefighter and paramedic were matched only by his bright smile and unfailing good nature. He was dearly loved by his fellow WVRS volunteers and will be greatly missed.All funds will be distributed directly to Kenny's family and help with any final services and arrangements.Thank you for your support in this challenging time.Read more

title: hckbxa help john recover
Description: The Society of the Friendly Sons of Saint Patrick of Baltimore Inc, and the Metropolitan Baltimore Fire Emerald Society are asking for donations  that will help our member John McMaster as he starts his recovery from the building collapse.John was working to extinguish a dwelling fire on Monday. As he entered the structure, there was a partial collapse of the building trapping John. He was rescued and is in Shock Trauma. His prognosis is good, but his path will be challenging.John’s road will be tough and we want to make it easier with helping with his bills so he can focus on his recovery. All funds raised will go directly to John. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to us.Read more

title: ksr and kentucky chamber foundation relief fund
Description: So many individuals, businesses, and more here in Kentucky and across the nation are looking for ways to help those impacted by deadly storms that swept through western Kentucky over the weekend, claiming many lives.Kentucky Sports Radio (KSR) and the Kentucky Chamber Foundation are partnering to build a relief fund for our fellow Kentuckians to ensure they are able to rebuild.With the money raised in this fund, our two groups will be working with local communities, local chambers, as well as our state and local elected officials to ensure the needs of these areas are met in the wake of tragedy. The funds will be distributed quickly to those groups to help our fellow Kentuckians rebuild.The Kentucky Chamber Foundation is a 501c3 entity and donations are tax-deductible.Individuals and companies can donate through the portal or contribute by mailing a check to 464 Chenault Rd. Frankfort, KY 40601 with ATTN to the Tornado Relief Fund.Match your donation!Share your donation receipt with your company and ask them if they will match your donation.KSR and the Kentucky Chamber are committed to helping rebuild our communities and we appreciate your help and the overwhelming compassion and generosity of so many.Read more

title: 2022sccs ptf jog a thon
Description: **When making a donation... please be sure to click on "REFERRED BY" and select the student/team member you want to support. It is located underneath payment information after clicking "Donate".** (Thank you in advance for your support!)It's that time of year again! title: meklinabedini
Description: Varfëria është sfida më e madhe me të cilën shqiptarët po përballen sot. Në këto ditë të vështira ku mjerimi ka mbuluar me një vel trishtimi familjet shqiptare, ka ardhur koha t’i japim dorën njëri tjetrit dhe të bashkojmë zemrat në emër të së mirës. Fundjavë Ndryshe ka vendosur të jetë në krah të çdo shqiptari që sot ka nevojë për ndihmën tonë. Dhuro edhe ti kontributin tënd për t’i ndryshuar jetën dikujt që ka nevojë për ty.Ne bashkepunim me emisionin StopDhuro për të mësuar sa shumë forcë ke në shpirt për të shpëtuar jetë dhe për të ndezur dritë në ato zemra, ku dikur varfëria kishte pllakosur errësirën!Deri tani Fundjavë Ndryshe ka restauruar 170 shtëpi dhe ka ndërtuar211 të tjera për familjet në nevojë, të cilat jetonin ne kushte ekstreme. Ka shpërndarë rreth 200 bursa studimi për fëmijët në nevojë, dhe synon të zhvillojë programe integrimi social për të gjithë fëmijët e familjeve që trajtohen. Janë vizituar rreth 19 mijë familje në të gjithë Shqipërinë, dhe u është ofruar ndihma mjekësore rreth 80 individëve. Janë punësuar rreth 300 kryefamiljarë, si dhe është skicuar harta e varfërisë në të gjithë vendin. Sot ne jemi 10 mijë vullnetarë, te gatshëm për të luftuar varfërinë. Këto statistika tregojnë se të gjithë bashkë mundemi! Fundjavë Ndryshe jemi të gjithë ne! Email: [email redacted] Website : www.fundjavendryshe.org Facebook Fundjavë NdrysheInstagramRead more

title: una casa para monjas budistas
Description: Durante 12 años, mientras servimos y difundimos el Dharma, nos hemos estado moviendo de un lugar a otro, en la India, México y los Estados Unidos, viviendo en lugares alquilados o prestados, intentando siempre mantener nuestra forma de vida monástica y sirviendo a nuestra querida comunidad laica hispano parlante. Empezamos como cuatro monjas budistas y somos ahora cinco. Varias mujeres nos han estado preguntando si ellas pueden tomar votos y unirse a nosotras, sin embargo, por carecer de un lugar de residencia permanente, no podemos atender sus solicitudes. Con el fin de ofrecer oportunidades a otras mujeres y atender a nuestra comunidad amplia que también está creciendo, ahora estamos planeando echar raíces y crear una base estable. ¡Ayúdanos a crear un hogar!A lo largo de los años, nos hemos conocido a través de los proyectos de FaceBuda, el Instituto Budadharma, las Salas de meditación Dharmadatta, y confiamos que ahora, con las aportaciones de tantas personas, por el poder colectivo podemos hacer realidad este lugar.Aquí en este sitio, vamos avanzando juntos hacia la meta. Súmate. Somos muchos. Aunque parezca lejos, juntas y juntos, con todo lo que cada quien pueda contribuir, lo lograremos.Te invitamos a regresar de vez en cuando a este sitio para ir viendo nuestro colectivo y regocijarnos por ello.QUIÉNES SOMOS: Una comunidad internacional de monjas budistas hispanoparlantes. Estamos profundamente comprometidas a crear un nuevo modelo de comunidad espiritual alejado de actitudes e instituciones patriarcales, a abrazar la responsabilidad de cuidar a la tierra, y a servir a nuestra comunidad laica de habla hispana.Damcho, monja durante 22 años, con un doctorado en Sánscrito y experiencia en periodismo. Originaria de Nueva York. Nuestra líder reluctante.Nangpel, monja durante 13 años, nacida en México, anteriormente investigadora académica. Cinta negra en aikido: con ella, ninguna de nosotras baja la guardia.Lodro, monja durante 7 años, anteriormente contadora, nacida en la República Dominicana y muy joven emigrada a Puerto Rico. Encargada no oficial de “risoterapia”.Dapel, monja durante 13 años, nacida en Suiza. Profesora de primaria antes de ordenarse. Con esta voz, tiene que ser nuestra “líder de canto”.Karya, nuestra monja más nueva, de Colombia. Profesora universitaria con un posgrado en semiótica.QUÉ HACEMOS:Para nosotras es muy importante que las desigualdades económicas no sean un impedimento para acceder al cuidado y a los servicios espirituales, particularmente en el budismo. Por esta razón ofrecemos todas nuestras actividades completamente libres de pago: retiros de meditación, sesiones de práctica en grupo en línea, cursos en línea y un programa de estudios de siete años de duración. Nuestras ofrendas y servicios de Dharma están disponibles y abiertos a cualquiera que hable español. De acuerdo con el mayor ejemplo budista, el Buda mismo, vivimos de las donaciones que recibimos. Y gracias a las y los amables donantes logramos cubrir los costos para vivir.Sin embargo, la necesidad de contar con un espacio estable para vivir se ha agudizado ahora. La cantidad que necesitamos reunir nos permitiría comenzar nuestro viaje hacia una sede estable. Tenemos un largo camino por recorrer y no podemos hacerlo solas. ¿Nos puedes ayudar a hacerlo?Cuando empezamos juntas, estábamos convencidas de que antes de construir un monasterio físico, era importante desarrollar primero los vínculos personales y las prácticas grupales que nos llevarían a ser una verdadera comunidad. Estamos felices de haber puesto el enfoque ahí en nuestra primera década, pero ahora realmente necesitamos establecernos en un lugar propio, que será también un lugar para ofrecer al mundo. Anhelamos crear un espacio seguro que podamos llenar con la energía de nuestra práctica y de nuestro amor, y ofrecer ese espacio como refugio a los demás. Anhelamos cuidar la tierra y soñamos en custodiar un bosque.¿Nos ayudarás a comprar una casa que pueda servir como base para que podamos seguir cuidando a la comunidad laica, mientras mantenemos nuestra vida contemplativa como monjas?Puedes ver el enfoque que ofrecemos en nuestro canal de YouTube. Encontrarás ahí series de enseñanzas sobre temas como trabajar con emociones difíciles, identidades de género, cultivar la generosidad con un corazón abierto, la compasión valiente y otras cualidades positivas, la conciencia y la acción ambiental, la simplicidad voluntaria y los sutras Mahayana. Nuestro canal tiene más de 160 000 suscriptores y esto nos permite llegar y beneficiar a muchas personas que no son budistas, así como a aquellas que de otro modo no tendrían acceso a un centro de Dharma. Desde la pandemia, cientos de personas se han unido a nuestros retiros de meditación en línea y han tomado cursos en nuestro instituto en línea. Nuestras salas de meditación, siempre abiertas, sirven a más de 35 000, todo de forma totalmente gratuita.Canal de YouTube "faceBuda" youtube.com/user/faceBuda/featuredSalas de meditación en línea (Salas de meditación Dharmadatta) budismoenlinea.ning.com/Cursos en línea (Instituto Budadharma) institutobudadharma.org/Programa de estudios de siete años institutobudadharma.org/programa-de-formacion/Para nosotras, la gratitud es fundamental, y todo lo que puedas ofrecer se apreciará profundamente y será utilizado con cuidado. Esta oportunidad de pedir tu ayuda es también una oportunidad para conectar y expandir las redes de compasión y cuidado que estamos construyendo. Si decides donar, por favor indícanos cómo te gustaría que dediquemos aspiraciones por ti. Hacemos plegarias dos veces al día por todas y todos nuestros benefactores.Con las palmas juntas, te damos las gracias de corazón, Damcho, Dapel, Karya, Lodro y Nangpel (y Tashi, nuestro amigo canino residente).Read more

title: tsunami relief tonga islands
Description: UPDATED JANUARY 29, 2022 @ 4:42 PMAPV OFFICIAL PRESS RELEASEMalo e lelei Community,On behalf of Anamatangi Polynesian Voices (APV), we want to acknowledge the overwhelming support we’ve received since the catastrophic event of Jan.15, 2022, which cast a Pacific-wide tsunami from Tonga to every corner of the earth. Our efforts in leading California’s aid to rebuild Tonga has quickly been hoisted onto the shoulders of our state politicians, philanthropic giants and our loved ones near and far. Together, we can.Our ask is simple – help us fill a Boeing 787 plane with pallets of emergency supplies that will go directly to our families on the ground, by giving what you can. Our people need your help, please act now.Thanks to our allies at UPS Foundation, over the next couple of weeks, several airplanes filled with over 170,000 pounds of emergency supplies will be departing from our beautiful state of California en route to Fua’amotu International Airport for unloading as early as next week. With the political muscle of California Senator Josh Becker, and the philanthropic influence of Sobrato Foundation, Bears Without Borders and Stanford Medical Health (to just name a few) , our collaborative commitment to supporting the Kingdom of Tonga is one that is rooted in addressing global climate change and sea level rising.Check out out website for the official packing list (in pallets) and to learn more about our village partners.We are deeply appreciative of your generosity towards supporting our Kingdom and our people.In Solidarity,Anamatangi Polynesian VoicesRead more

title: please save damian
Description: MY BABY IS DYING, PLEASE HELP!Everyone who meets Damian is instantly smitten with him. My 2-year-old is truly an angel on earth – sweet, smiley, social, and has recently started cupping his cheeks with his hands to form the cutest smile you’ve ever seen!Damian was also recently diagnosed with a devastatingly fatal disease called Acid Sphingomyelinase Deficiency (ASMD), also referred to as Niemann-Pick Disease Types A & B (NPA & NPB). Damian’s case appears to be a mild form of Type A, the most severe form of the disease, which is characterized by an early onset (infancy) of progressive systemic manifestations such as:· an enlarged liver and spleen· loss of muscle tone· failure to thrive· rapid neurodegeneration (think baby Alzheimer’s) that leads to death typically by 3 years of age Since Damian’s case is mild, he has a greater chance of living past 3 years old. However, any neurological damage that Damian incurs likely can’t be reversed, and if nothing is done to stop or slow the progression of his disease, he will likely die before his 5th birthday.WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SAVE DAMIANTwo potentially promising treatments are on the horizon, but funding is desperately needed to speed up the timeline and clear the pathway to a clinical trial. With your help, collectively we have a chance to save Damian’s life.Please, help me save my precious boy. Please #SaveDamian. Whether or not you are able to donate, please spread the word and share this campaign with others. Thank you, thank you, thank you. <3Love,Brittany (Damian's Mom) and Brock (Damian’s Dad)HOW YOU CAN HELP TODAY1. Donate what you can, no amount too small (donations are tax deductible)2. Share on all social media with the hashtag #SaveDamian3. Email our GoFundMe and these steps to all contacts4. Leverage any avenue you have to make this go viral (or send me leads/tips)!- TIP! - DOUBLE YOUR DONATIONMany employers are set up to match contributions their employees make to any 501(c)3 non-profit charity, so please check with your HR manager as it could double your donation!WHERE THE MONEY IS GOINGAll contributions are tax deductible and go to the Wylder Nation Foundation, a 501(c)3 non-profit organization (Tax ID: 46-2849095) who has been funding this research that can give Damian a shot at life. 100% of the funds raised here will go directly to fast-tracking this research and what is needed to initiate a clinical trial. The research includes a unique small molecule that passes the blood brain barrier (BBB) and has demonstrated remarkable results at potentially slowing or stopping the rapid course of neurodegeneration that happens in NPA. Additional research is surrounding a gene therapy that has the potential to replace the defective gene responsible for Damian’s disease with a functioning working copy of the gene for a more permanent treatment.THERE IS A CLEAR PATH TO TREATMENT1. Manufacture clinical grade drug production2. Final safety studies3. Get FDA approval to proceed with clinical drug4. Start clinical trialIf you would like to donate by check, please make the check out to:Wylder Nation Foundation (in memo write #SaveDamian)Send To:Wylder Nation Foundation8924 E. Pinnacle Peak RdSte. G5-574Scottsdale, AZ 85255Read more

title: amhara emergency fund
Description: አማራን እንደ ህዝብ ኢትዮጵያን እንደ ሃገር የማስቀጠል/የማዳን እና ለወገን ደጀን የመሆን ጥሪ!አማራው በዜግነቱ እንደማንኛውም ኢትዮጵያዊ በሚኖርባቸው የአገሪቱ ማዕዘናት በፖለቲካዊ እቅድ ተለይቶ ሲገደል፣ ሲፈናቀልና ሲሳደድ ለከፋ ማኅበራዊና ኢኮኖሚያዊ ቀውስ ተዳርጎ በችግር ሲማቅቅ በርካታ ዐሠርት አመታትን አሳልፏል። ይህ አንሶት ዛሬ "የለውጥ ዘመን" በሚባለው ጊዜ ከነዘር ምንዝሩ እየተጨፈጨፈ፣ የተገኘባቸው ቀዬዎችና ከተሞች እየወደሙ፣ በነፍስ የተረፈው በመቶ ሺዎች የሚቆጠር ህዝብ በአገሩ ስደተኛ ሆኖ አለበቂ መጠለያ የእለት ጉርስ ተመጽዋች ሆኖ ይገኛል።ይባስ ብሎ ትህነግ "ከአማራ ጋር ሂሳብ አወራርዳለሁ" ብሎ በከፈተብን ጦርነት እነሆ አገር መጋቢው የአማራ ገበሬ ማሳ በማለስለሻውና በመዝሪያው ወቅት፣ በሐምሌ፣ ትህነግ ጦርነት በከፈተባቸው ግንባሮች ሁሉ ህልውናውን ለማስከበር በመዋደቅ ላይ ይገኛል ። ይህ ጦርነት የአማራው ብቻ ሳይሆን የመላ አገሪቱ የህልውና ስጋት ነው። ይህን በችግር ኖሮ አገር ደግፎ ያኖረ ህዝብ በዚህ ክፉ ቀን መደገፍ ኢትዮጵያን ማዳን መሆኑን ማንም አገሩን የሚወድ አይስተውም። በዚህ እምነት በአሜሪካ፤ በካናዳ፤ በአውሮፓ በአውስትራሊያ ፤ ኒውዚ ላንድ እንዲሁም አፍሪካ እና እስያ ያሉ የአማራ ማህበራት ከወንፈል ጋር በመተባበር ለወገናችን የምግብ እና የህክምና እርዳታ የሚውል የገንዘብ ማሰባሰቢያ መርሀ ግብር አዘጋጅተናል። በዚህም ሆነ በሌሎች ተመሳሳይ የእርዳታ ማሰባሰቢያ አጋርነታችሁን ላሳያችሁ እርዳታው በታቀደለት ወገናችን ስም ከፍ ያለ ምስጋና ይድረሳችሁ። የመርሀ ግብሩን ሂደት በየጊዜው በኢሜይልና በዚህ ገጽ እናሳውቃለን።ከዚህ ገንዘብ ማሰባሰቢያ ውጭ የሚደረጉ እንደ ቴሌቶን ያሉ መርሐ ግብሮች እያዘጋጀን እናስ ታውቃለን።የሚከተሉትን አማራጭ የገንዘብ መለገሻ መንገዶች ሊጠቀሙ ይችላሉ:: Please include “Amhara Emergency Fund” in the comment section1. Wonfel Paypal Giving Acct: paypal.com/us/fundraiser/charity/35584282. For Venmo and Zelle please use the Wonfel email: info'@‘wonfel.org*************For the last three years, Amharas were under consistent attack and people have been suffering. Millions have been displaced, thousands wounded and hundreds of children orphaned. The current conflict in northern Ethiopia is worsening the situation specifically after TPLF declared an all out war on Amhara. It is high time for us Ethiopians to stand together and look after one another. Let’s act collectively and contain our brothers and sisters’ suffering before it spreads to the rest of our country. Your donations will go a great length to provide emergency food, medical supplies and shelter. If not NOW, when? If not US, who will stand for our people?**********************Partcipating OrganizationsFederation of Amharas in North America (FANA)Amhara Association of America - [email redacted]     Amhara Professionals Union - [email redacted]Amhara Association of Colorado - [email redacted]Amhara People’s Civic Organization (Dallas) - [email redacted]Amhara Association in Georgia - [email redacted]Amhara Association in Seattle - [email redacted]Amhara Association of California - [email redacted]Amhara Association of Los Angeles - [email redacted]Amhara Association of Nevada - [email redacted]Amhara Heritage Society of Minnesota - [email redacted]Canadian Amhara Societies Alliance (CASA) – [email redacted]International Amhara Alliance (IAA) – [email redacted]Amhara Support, Relief & Rehabilitation Association (ASRRA) - New Zealand – [email redacted]Yotor Farmers' Association [email redacted]International Amhara Union [email redacted]Amhara Association of NorwayWonfel Aid [email redacted]Interviewshttps://youtu.be/U6KrypquaDohttps://youtu.be/Osqu1MBH9MYhttps://youtu.be/5gZE3PnFqd0https://youtu.be/LTILl-HTZzwhttps://youtu.be/qYDOtU_2dq8https://youtu.be/Tx29iBwQeaAhttps://youtu.be/U6KrypquaDohttps://youtu.be/jCzv9G6uDbUhttps://youtu.be/S5O6K9q6guYRead more

title: jaclyn ehrlich for ewings sarcoma research
Description: Jaclyn was a 16 year old high school junior playing varsity soccer, serving as VP of student government and looking forward to her junior prom when her world, and ours, changed when she was diagnosed with Ewing’s Sarcoma.  Jaclyn fought bravely for 2 and 1/2 years, and while enduring treatments, chemotherapy, surgery, more chemotherapy, more surgery, experimental clinical trials, and radiation she refused to stop living her life the way she wanted to.  She attended her junior prom.  She endured her treatment and earned a 4.0 GPA her senior year of high school.  From her hospital bed she coordinated summer soccer practice and with a boot attended as many practices and games as possible earning her the most courageous athlete award.  Still, while enduring chemo treatment she attended her freshman year of college at UCF and earned a 3.8 GPA, joined AEPhi sorority and got involved in Knight-Thon and philanthropy events.   Unfortunately Jaclyn’s battle ended August 8, 2021, when she could not fight any longer.  She is an example of living every minute to its absolute fullest and is a true inspiration to everyone who knew her.  She was taken from us to soon and will be forever missed.  Please help us honor her by supporting research to end this awful disease.  Your donation is truly appreciated. -The Ehrlich FamilyRead more

title: jacks walk of honour
Description: Myself, David, our sons Ross and Cian and our daughters Sarah and Holly, would like to welcome all who are interested to come and walk in Jack's honor to raise funds for suicide awareness. The walk will begin at the Church in Abbeylara Co Longford on the 5th of February at 2pm. Jack had a passion for his daily walks and as a remembrance to our dear son, brother, and friend we will be walking 5Km for his birthday. We hope to remind everyone to remember the traditions of their past loved ones while raising awareness for the ever-present problem surrounding mental health.No contribution is too big nor too small as all funds are going directly to pieta house and will only strengthen the cause. We hope that all the lives jack touched can reach out in this time to help make progress on the fight against mental health and suicide.If you cannot attend in Longford we encourage you to take to your local park, area or wherever to take part in the 5Km walk .Read more

title: alexs fundraiser for bruces legacy
Description: The Charity’s CauseFriends and Family -On April 10th, I’m going to attempt to complete my first triathlon (help) to raise money for an organization called Bruce’s Legacy.Bruce’s Legacy is a 501 (C)(3) volunteer organization providing emergency assistance, education, public safety awareness and search and recovery operations for drowned victims to provide resolutions for families.In honor of my brother's 28th birthday on 2/16/22, I am humbly requesting donations be in increments of $28.How your donation will help!Bruce’s Legacy is requesting your help to fund a Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV) at a cost of $95,000.The ROV funds raised to-date is $67,950.This is a volunteer organization, which relies on donations from businesses and individuals. All donations received on this site will go directly towards the ROV.My Story:I remember the knock on the front door like it was yesterday. It was Sunday night, 1/3/16, and I was standing near the door with my suitcase packed. My now wife and I were ready leave for the airport to fly back to California after visiting my family in Chicago for the holidays.I opened the door. Two officers stood there with stoic facial expressions. It’s a hard feeling to describe but they were there to deliver devastating news. They could not provide many details to me or my family, but told us to get in the car and drive to Mill Lake, Wisconsin. We were told there had been an accident.Despite repeated attempts to get any information from them on what happened, the officers responded with the same coordinated response. ‘Please get in the car and drive to the lake”.Keep in mind this is an hour and a half drive north from my family's house. I would not wish that car ride on my worst enemy.Upon arrival, we were told by other grieving families that Pat and 3 friends returned home from the bar the night before and took a canoe out on the lake. They never returned home.A decision to get in a canoe, on what should have been a new years eve weekend celebration, has changed my life forever. As my sister Liz put it so perfectly 6 years ago, Pat has taught me and my family how fragile life really is. Everyday is a gift. Since that knock on my front door, my mindset on life has changed forever. Patrick was reported missing on 1/3/16, but we did not find him until 1/8/16. The Walworth County Sheriff’s Department allowed Bruce’s Legacy to join in the search for Patrick on day three since the canoe accident.The following is a recap written by Keith about the recovery from his website:"Upon their arrival, Mill Lake had just frozen over completely with 2-4” of ice. With the help of some locals and their work boats, they broke up paths of ice that enabled Bruce’s Legacy to travel about one mile to the search site. After one day on the water, they collected four sonar images of interest to investigate further. The search area from the previous day had again frozen over. Because of the amount of damage from breaking ice to some of the boats, coupled with unsafe ice conditions, it was too dangerous to put anyone out in this area. So, a plan was put into place to get scuba divers into the area as soon as ice conditions were safer. Meanwhile, the Walworth County Dive Team continued to assess the scene each morning. Eventually, the warmer temperatures allowed the dive team to enter the water. They were able to make the recovery.Among the many challenges to conduct the search were: (1) ice on the lake that needed to broken up and path cleared (2) A brand new boat fitted with a new sonar and winch system that they had just configured without a trial run to see how well it would work together (3) A first-time boat operator that took off from work to help Bruce’s Legacy out (4) The thick mass of weeds in this area of the lake made it tough to get good, clear sonar images."With the help of Bruce’s Legacy, we were able to locate Patrick after five painful days and bring some sort of closure to me and my family.There are good people out there. Keith is one of them. I cannot thank him and his team enough for supporting my family in a dire time of need.I hope you never need their services, but for those families that do, I ask you to help with a donation to keep them moving forward and assisting those families in need. Thank you for considering.Read more

title: love has no borders help our turkish partners
Description: With no end to the CDC ban in sight, our Turkish rescue partners need our help now more than ever!!Not a day goes by without requests to help abandoned goldens, most of them in desperate need of medical help. Winter has set in, the shelters are overcrowded, and the rescuers are running out of room and resources to care for the goldens in need. Making it worse, the value of the Turkish lira has dropped dramatically, and pet supplies and medications are costing 3 times more than they did last month. It's even getting more difficult to find and afford quality pet food, which they hope to stockpile to get through the winter. Without the resources to care for them, they are having to leave many needy dogs on the streets. The government is being less tolerant to strays, which makes their future very bleak.While we can't bring any dogs over yet, eventually the ban will be lifted. There will likely be new requirements for rabies titers, which will increase transport costs. But their immediate need is financial, so that they can continue to help the goldens in their care, like Leo, Dost, Pascal, Pasha, and Amigo.Leo and Dost both had severe leg fractures that have been repaired, and Dost (meaning "close friend") still needs a hip replacement. Pascal was found with severe dermatitis and puncture wounds on his feet from sharp weeds between his toes. Pasha's family left him at an automotive industrial site when they got older, hoping someone would take care of him. And Amigo was found as a survivor from a car crash.Let's help our Turkish rescue partners get these dogs the help they need!! Proceeds from this fundraiser will be sent to Gamze, Yasemin, and Sevil to care for the many precious goldens that need them. With our help now, hopefully they can weather this storm and get back to sending us goldens once the ban is lifted. We will continue to update you on the progress of these dogs and many others in their care.Read more

title: return missions trip to pelle walla
Description: I am so excited to have the opportunity to make a return trip to the the village of Pelle Walla in East Africa! On my last trip our goal was to train their current teachers on ways to teach the gospel to the children in their village school. On our return trip we are taking over audio Bibles that make the Bible accessible to them in their native language. We also get to follow up on our instruction from our last trip and spend even more time in the village school! I got to meet my sponsor child that I have been sponsoring the last few years and hope to get to see her again! Please join me by praying for the safety of our travels and time there! For good health, smooth transitions, and thought many would come to know the Lord through our time there! If you feel lead to donate to this page all money goes to cover the cost of my travels and lodging for this return missions trip! Thank you so much for your prayers and help:) Read more

Description: Ukraine Humanitarian Appeal#HelpUkraineNowRussian threats to invade Ukraine again pose the largest threat to international global security since WWII. title: raiden science foundation
Description: We are launching a GoFundMe campaign this holiday season to accelerate promising research & therapeutic development for UBA5. UBA5 is a rare progressive neurological genetic disorder. There have been less than 30 genetically confirmed and reported cases in the world. Life expectancy is unknown, and kids impacted can suffer from movement disability, cognitive impairment, and uncontrollable epilepsy. There are no effective treatments or cures currently for UBA5 disease.Our son, Raiden Pham, suffers from UBA5 disease. He is still young and slowly progressing cognitively. While Raiden is at high risk for seizures, they have not yet begun and so we are racing against time. If we can deliver gene therapy for Raiden soon enough, we may be able to reverse his disease trajectory and give him a better quality of life. We are not giving up on him. Read about Raiden’s Story and follow his journey on Instagram @Raiden_Journey.We founded the Raiden Science Foundation (“RSF”) to enable impactful research to help Raiden and other patients suffering from UBA5 disease. Visit our websiteOur MISSION is to harness to power of family, community, and science to accelerate development of UBA5 therapies. We are breaking down research barriers to advance gene therapy for UBA5. Raiden was diagnosed in August, and within 2 months, we established a partnership with UMass Chan Medical School to make this more than just a hope. The UMass team will be creating a gene replacement therapy program for UBA5 once we raise funds.Our VISION is to create a future where there are paths forward for treating rare diseases and empowering families to make a difference. Not only will our work lead to giving kids suffering from UBA5 disease a chance for a better quality of life, but we are also pushing forward medical innovation that can help millions suffering from rare diseases around the world. We are currently exploring additional research partnerships with St. Jude Children’s Hospital, Baylor College of Medicine, and Oregon Health & Science University. Read about our workThe only way Raiden and potentially other UBA5 patients can receive gene therapy within 3 years is to raise $1+ million to start the research program. Time keeps marching forward for Raiden, but it hasn’t yet started for UBA5 gene therapy development.Together, we can do this.Please donate if you can and/or share this campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues.No donations will be used for Raiden’s care or other personal use. Raiden Science Foundation is an Oregon nonprofit operating through a fiscal sponsorship with Rare Village Foundation, a Texas 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization. Donations to RSF are tax-deductible within the guidelines of U.S. law. Rare Village Foundation will manage the funds and ensure that they will go directly to Raiden Science Foundation to only accomplish our mission.Read more

title: 26jan shqiptaret per shqiptaret
Description: Të dashur vëllezër dhe motra!Jeta e përditshme e atyre me më pak fat se ne është një luftë që është e vështirë të kuptohet nga shume prej nesh. Imagjinoni ndjenjën e deshpermimit të një familjeje pa çati mbi kokë, apo të dikujt që nuk mund të sigurojë ushqim, veshje apo nevoja mjekësore për veten dhe fëmijët e tij. Fatkeqësisht, këto janë shqetësime reale në jetën e shumë bashkatdhetarëve tane shqiptarë për shkak të rrethanave jashtë kontrollit të tyre. Askush nuk dëshiron të jetë në atë pozitë, por fatkeqësisht shumë janë. Misioni ynë është i qarte, tu shërbejme dhe tu ndihmojme sa me shumë vëllezërve dhe motrave tona në nevojë, por misioni ynë nuk do të ishte i mundur pa mbështetjen tuaj. Ju jeni ata qe mund të siguroni një të ardhme të ndritur për jetimët, shpresë për të pafuqishmit e lehtësim për të sëmurët."Permireso një jetë, ndrysho një botë" kjo është filozofia jonë. Vizioni ynë është të fuqizojmë njerëzit dhe t'i aftësojmë ata që të ndihmojnë veten dhe komunitetet e tyre. Le të bashkohemi së bashku e t'i kthejmë lotët e dëshpërimit në lot gëzimi. Ne besojme fort që çdo moment eshte i rëndësishem, sepse cdo dite ka jetë qe ndalojne në pritje te një dore ndihmë.Faleminderit dhe Zoti ju bekoftë ju dhe familjet tuaja!Dear Brothers and Sisters!The day-to-day living of those less fortunate than us is a struggle that is hard to imagine in our modernized activities. Imagine the feeling of hopelessness of a family without a roof on their head, or someone unable to provide food, clothing, and medical needs for himself and his kids.Unfortunately, these are real concerns in the lives of many fellow Albanians due to circumstances outside of their control. No one wants to be in that position, but unfortunately many are. Our mission is to serve and help our brothers and sisters in need, but our mission would not be possible without your support. You can ensure a bright future for the orphans, offer hope for the helpless, and provide relief for the sick."Brighten a life, change a world" is our philosophy. Our vision is to empower people and enable them to help themselves and their communities. Let’s get together and turn tears of desperation into tears of joy. We are strong believers that every moment counts because lives are on hold for every day that goes by without a helping hand.Thank you and may God Bless you and your families!Read more

title: raising for ontario native womens association
Description: I've been feeling helpless while watching the trucker convoy fundraising climb past $6 million, and wondering why we as a country aren't rallying like this for crucial, basic needs like clean water, food security and everyday safety for Indigenous communities. Instead of waiting for someone else to do it, I've started this campaign to benefit the Ontario Native Women's Charitable Foundation. I've chatted with the wonderful folks there, and any donation will certainly help make an impact.The Ontario Native Women’s Association (ONWA) is a not for profit organization to empower and support all Indigenous women and their families in the province of Ontario through research, advocacy, policy development and programs that focus on local, regional and provincial activities.Established in 1971, ONWA delivers culturally enriched programs and services to Indigenous women and their families regardless of their status or locality. They are committed to providing services that strengthen communities and guarantee the preservation of Indigenous culture, identity, art, language and heritage. Ending violence against Indigenous women and their families and ensuring equal access to justice, education, health services, environmental stewardship and economic development, sit at the cornerstone of the organization. ONWA insists on social and cultural well–being for all Indigenous women and their families, so that all women, regardless of tribal heritage may live their best life.Please check out onwa.ca for more information. Thank you. xoRead more

title: zeus was mauled by a dog rushed to emergency
Description: What we learned is that Zeus’s owners went away and left him with a sitter. The sitter had their own large dog(s) who attacked Zeus, however the sitter didn’t inform the owners and let the pup stay like this for a few days until the owners came back to get him. The owners couldn’t provide the emergency treatment the dog required and brought him to the vet office to be euthanized. That is when we were contacted for help. Even though the chances of saving him are small, we wanted to try and took on this dire case. We discovered that Zeus has deep bite wounds that went through the entire side of the head into the ear canal, as a result he has severe abscesses with puss and blood oozing out. All of the tissue on the side of the head is rock hard as it became necrotic tissue. The fluid is filling the inside of his ear continuously. One of the eyes suffered a very bad corneal abrasion. He's also got a couple of bite wounds with abscesses on the other side of his head. We contacted the emergency hospital and it cost $8,000 to just bring Zeus through the door. We refuse to believe that there’s a price tag on Zeus’s life! But we need your help to prove it! Would you please help us save his life? We can’t do this without you.Read more

title: bughouse theater rentelethon
Description: BUGHOUSE THEATER RENTELETHONTUNE INSunday, January 30th6pm CSTLive on Bughouse Theater TwitchFor almost a decade, Bughouse Theater has been serving the community as a space for performers to do what inspires them. We are a non-profit organization devoted to fostering an appreciation of the arts, the artistic growth of our members, and facilitating the collaboration of diverse artists across all media and disciplines. We’ve brought the arts to schools and community organizations. We have created a place where a blend of artists, performers, and comedians can call home.Bughouse Theater has struggled over the course of the pandemic. We only just reopened our doors in the summer of 2021 with a limited run of shows. As the rates of cases have risen, we've had to make sacrifices and work even harder to provide a safe space for performers, but those challenges make it a struggle to make ends meet.We're asking for your support now in anticipation of the Bughouse Rentelethon on January 30th. This Twitch-streamed event will showcase performances from the comedic talent supported by our theater. Prior to and during this extravaganza, our goal is to raise $5,000. With your donations, we can continue forging ahead in our artistic mission while taking care of the theater's basic needs.Read more

title: rebuildchabad
Description: We just got the SHOCKING news that our synagogue went up in flames this morning...!The Chabad House at 1088 Branham Ln, San Jose CA served as a warm Community Center for the Jewish community.We ask of the community to come together with love, support, and togetherness to help grow the Chabad! In the shadow of the fire, and amongst the ashes, a light of unity will shine brighter and much longer than the fire of destruction.**Rabbi Mendel Weinfeld moved from Brooklyn two years ago to start the Chabad House in Almaden Valley, said he’s focused on helping his community recover."Over the past month, we are so thankful to received more than $650,000 in donations to recover from the loss and build something beautiful for the community". Astonished by the overwhelming support, Weinfeld is setting his sights even higher with plans to launch a capital campaign called “rise from the ashes” with the goal of raising $4.5 million to purchase a facility more than double the size of the space they had before.“Right away we went into recovery mode,” Weinfeld said. “But upon contemplating, what we realized is that the community really needs a permanent, warm home where they can congregate, embrace their heritage and celebrate it openly.“The end goal will be that the community has a place to learn, gather and grow together.”The fire that destroyed the synagogue broke out around 1 a.m. on Dec. 22, 2021. Security camera footage appeared to show an individual walk into the building’s carport with smoke and flames emanating from that area shortly thereafter. The flamesspread from the carport to a space between the first and second floors of the building, damaging nearly everything inside.The fire was not reported until shortly before 7 a.m. when waste collectors arrived to pick up the garbage. But firefighters, with the help of a community member, were still able to spare the synagogue’s Torah scrolls. Grainy images of an individual who was near the carport at the time the fire broke out were distributed to the San Jose Police Department for assistance locating the individual, but no leads have surfaced, according to Erica Ray, spokesperson for the city’s fire department. Three days after the fire, the Chabad House was broken into and vandalized, but the building’s security cameras had already been taken down so no images were captured for investigators.Venmo | Credit CardChecks can be written out to Chabad:5931 Porto Alegre Dr, San Jose CA 95120More information about The Chabad HouseRead more

title: help home care workers recover from bronx fire
Description: On January 9, our Fordham Heights community was devastated by a deadly fire in the apartment building at 333 East 181st Street. Among the dozens of families and individuals affected by this tragedy, three essential health care workers lost their homes and possessions. Their names are Mercedes De La Cruz, Maimouna Mahamadou, and Bintou Sumareh.At the time the fire broke out, they were working at Cooperative Home Care Associates (CHCA), assisting older adults and people with disabilities in our community. They have regularly provided this essential care during the COVID-19 pandemic, taking great personal risks to help their clients stay healthy and supported through this difficult time. Now, Mercedes, Maimouna, and Bintou need our help to recover from the fire’s devastating impact.Please consider joining us as we extend our arms and open our hearts to these amazing women and their families. 100% of your donation will go toward helping them to rebuild their lives.This campaign is managed by PHI, the nonprofit partner of CHCA and the country’s leading voice on direct care workforce issues. All funds raised will be passed through PHI to CHCA, and distributed directly to the three workers impacted by the fire.Read more

title: sjp hockey fundraiser for lieutenant derek hines
Description: https://derekhinesfund.com/about/Hello SJP Hockey Families, Friends and supporters.Each year, for the past 13 years, the SJP Varsity Hockey Team raises funds to support the 1st Lt. Derek Hines Soldiers Assistance FundFor those of you that do not know, Derek was a four-year varsity hockey player at St John’s Prep, graduating in 1999.Upon graduation, he went to West Point where he played all four years and was captain in his senior year. After graduating from West Point in 2003, Derek was deployed to Afghanistan where he was assigned to direct artillery as a fire support officer for an infantry company.Derek was sadly killed in action in service of his country onSeptember 1, 2005. He was 25.His number 23 has been retired from SJP Hockey and hangs at the Essex rink.Now going on its 14th year, SJP will be playing Newburyport High School (Derek's hometown) on February 12th in the Derek Hines Memorial Game. In past years the varsity hockey team has presented the proceeds to the Hines family prior to the start of the game. All money raised from the fundraiser goes directly to the 1st Lt. Derek Hines Soldiers Assistance Fund.As we know, the past few years have presented unique and extraordinary challenges and circumstances.Once again, we are unable to gather together to support this special event as we have in the past. Instead, we are requesting donations to be made directly to the Hines Fund to meet our goal.We ask you to please consider making a donation to honor the legacy and sacrifice of Derek and to continue the proud tradition that has been established by the Prep Hockey community in the past. Donations can be made through this page or directly to the Derek Hines Fund via this link: https://derekhinesfund.com/donations/stjohnsprepfundraiser2022/We are requesting that all donations be made by February 11th.Read more

title: erin merryn birthday fundraiser
Description: My name is Erin Merryn and I am a survivor of child sexual abuse. The path to justice for survivors of sexual assault is not an easy road. Unfortunately for many survivors they never see their perpetrators held accountable. CAASE helps survivors get the support and justice they deserve at no cost to the survivor. I was lucky to have found CAASE when I pursued justice decades after my abuse ended. I now want to help other survivors get the support they need at no cost. CAASE is a 501c3 and your donation is tax deductible. Helping one survivor through the legal process cost thousands and CAASE clients are never charged.You can make a difference by donating today to Chicago Alliance Against Sexual Exploitation (Caase). CAASE addresses the culture, institutions, and individuals that perpetrate, profit from, or support sexual exploitation.Their work includes prevention, policy reform, community engagement, and legal services.Read more

title: the rocko fund
Description: The gruesome pictures on a local lost and found Facebook page were hard to look at. A large breed dog had been hit by a car, laying spread out limp on the road while passerby’s tried to somehow help until Animal Control arrived.The officer immediately rushed him to a local full service vet clinic. Animal Control doesn’t have much in their budget for this sort of thing, so the vet called HSNBA. We were more than happy to spring for some diagnostics to find out how bad his injuries were. X-rays were what we expected, a pelvis broken in a couple of different places but other than that, he appeared to have no other internal injuries. He was being kept very comfortable and spoiled rotten by the vet techs. Everyone’s biggest concern was if the injury had caused enough damage to prevent him from being able to relieve himself on his own. There was also a chance that his owner could be looking for him so we waited and watched.After a few days, when no one stepped forward and it became obvious he wasn’t able to control when or where he went to the bathroom, we had to have a tough conversation. After careful consideration between the vet and the director at HSNBA, the difficult decision was made to humanely euthanize “Rocko”. The cost of the surgery was a big factor but more so, the prognosis of the surgery being successful and him being able to live any sort of normal life was slim.The following day, the vet techs who had grown so fond of him these last weeks were determined to give him a grand send off. They spent their lunch break with him in the sunny courtyard at the clinic, feeding him pizza and giving him belly rubs. Throughout the whole ordeal, Rocko - as they had named him because he was so tough - had been nothing but affectionate and eager to please, despite the pain he must have been in and the confusion he certainly was experiencing. There wasn’t a dry eye for miles as the veterinarian came out with Rocko’s final injection.That’s when Rocko righted himself as best he could given his injuries, hobbled across the courtyard and took a very deliberate poo. Then meandered over to the tree shading the courtyard and peed. On purpose. Exactly where he meant to.The vet and technicians stood in awe and disbelief. They looked at each other and the vet reached for his phone to call the shelter director……With this new indication that Rocko COULD indeed have full control of his bodily functions, the plan for euthanasia was tossed out like stale biscuits and a new plan was hatched.Rocko needs a pretty pricey surgery to repair the damage done by the accident. He has already racked up $1000 worth of x-rays, diagnostics, medications and boarding and we need another $1500 to get him on the road to recovery. We need to raise these funds fast and get this terrific death defying dog on track to finding his forever home! Anything raised over his bill, will of course go to the next dog in need.We are anticipating after 6-8 weeks of healing post op, he will be ready to get back to the business of being a dog, and we are actively looking for a foster or adopter to give this dog his second chance at a first class life!Help Us Help Him!Read more

title: fundraiser for family who lost 2 children in fire

Once we have more information on that we will share. Read more

Description: Want to join us in making a difference? We're raising money to benefit Banditas Wild Horse Promise, and any donation will help make an impact. title: help kabbalah experience welcome afghan newcomers
Description: Help Kabbalah Experience welcome and support an Afghan refugee family in Denver. 47,000 Afghans in need of protection live on military bases waiting for communities across the country to receive them. We are excited to help a family of newcomers acclimate to Denver.Our community is creating a sponsor circle with the guidance of HIAS . We have an urgent need to raise money to sponsor and support an Afghan family as they transition to life in Denver.Sponsor circles are community-led refugee resettlement initiatives. Our sponsor circle will provide an Afghan family with housing and transportation assistance, employment and education opportunities, and emotional and moral support as they navigate and build relationships within their new community.We need your help to meet our goal of raising $15,000 for this vital project. We’ve already raised $7,000 from initial requests for help!.Any amount will make a difference and help us reach our goal. Once we reach our goal, we will connect with an Afghan family in Denver. The money we raise will pay for their rent, legal fees and home goods. Some funds will go directly to the family as they seek employment and pursue education.To learn more about the initiative, contact Sponsor Circle Members:Amy EngelmanElizabeth FreudenthalSarah GropeMelanie GruenwaldSharon HwangAmy MorrisSarah MorrisLizzy NeufeldDavid SandersDevin TomiakStephanie WassermanKabbalah Experience is a 501(c)3 non-profit, and all funds will be distributed to resettlement efforts for an Afghan Refugee Family.More details available at: https://kabbalahexperience.com/afghan-resettlement/Read more

title: build affordable housing in new orleans
Description: Bethlehem Lutheran Church needs your help now to build ADA-accessible affordable housing in the heart of New Orleans through an innovative partnership with the Tulane University School of Architecture.Our beloved neighbors and unique culture cannot survive without affordable housing. Can you share our Facebook post and then give $20 today to build this house?#BuildAHomeWithBethlehemScroll down for the full story!-Facebook Post- https://www.facebook.com/BethlehemNOLA/posts/2695373577433281-Other ways to give-Checks and Cash can be sent to:Bethlehem Lutheran Church1823 Washington AveNew Orleans, LA 70113EIN# 72-0497929Bethlehem Lutheran Church - Free Meals to Affordable HousingIn January 2022, Bethlehem Lutheran Church, one of the oldest historically Black Lutheran Congregations in the United States, celebrates its 133rd anniversary in New Orleans' Central City neighborhood. Over the last two years, Bethlehem has served over 45,000 gourmet meals to the community through Community Table, a program that serves around 500 free, no-questions-asked meals a week. On this momentous occasion, we are expanding our commitment to serve our neighbors by taking action against the affordable housing crisis in our neighborhood. This Spring, with your help, we will build the first of four new affordable housing units across from the church.The Affordable Housing Crisis in New OrleansOur vibrant Central City neighborhood is currently under assault by housing and rental prices - a crisis only intensified by Hurricane Ida. For example, the Median Household Income of Bethlehem’s 70113 ZIP is $18,446, and in New Orleans you would have to work 113 hours a week at minimum wage to afford a 2bd rental at fair market rent. Meanwhile, the waiting list for affordable housing vouchers in New Orleans is over 20,000 people long. At every meal we serve, we hear terrible stories from our neighbors about illegal evictions, unsafe living conditions, and rent prices that families simply cannot afford.Project ScopeThe first phase of our project will focus on constructing four new affordable rental units over the new four years. Our first house will be 1100 sqft, features a beautiful interior courtyard, and has been designed from the beginning to be ADA-accessible throughout. After we've begun this work by creating affordable housing, the second phase will build a much-needed new santuary for Bethlehem Lutheran Church to allow us to expand our kitchen and provide space to serve our neighborhood in new ways.Partner - Tulane University School of ArchitectureTo build these townhouses, Bethlehem Lutheran Church is partnering with URBANbuild, an award-winning program at the Tulane University School of Architecture. In this program students design a house each fall and build it in the spring. One of the innovative aspects of this partnership has been the collaboration between Bethlehem and the Architecture students throughout the design process. Another is that the School of Architecture is donating the design and labor for this project, allowing us to construct the first townhouse, clear the lot of concrete, and do all necessary permiting for $225,000.Partner - CrescentCareAs each unit of housing is completed, we will partner with CrescentCare, one of New Orleans' most respected community health organizations, to provide housing and supportive care to community members. CrescentCare provides high quality and culturally humble care to the entire New Orleans community. They are particularly focused on our Greater New Orleans neighbors who come from traditionally medically underserved communities: the service industry, the LGBTQ community, the uninsured and the underinsured, immigrants, and communities of color.Groundbreaking This Week!The groundbreaking ceremony for this project is Sunday, January 9th at 12pm. We would love for you to join us if you're in town!Because this project is already underway, it is imperative that we raise this money by Mardi Gras Day (March 1st). With your help, we will open our first unit of affordable housing this June!Recognition:Institutions that give at least $5,000 and Individuals/Familiesthat give at least $1,000 will receive special recognition on site.Everyone who contributes will be invited in-person or virtually to our dedication party (with special musical guests) once the house is completed!Our Ask:Please join us and give what you can as we work together to reach our initial $50k fundraising goal. This will pay for the lumber, exterior walls, exterior doors, and exterior windows for this house! Rendering of the houseWe will be building four houses over the next four yearsWe Never Stop Serving our Community  The Future Site Being Cleared this December We served over 9000 meals in the 18 days after Hurricane Ida this fallCheck out this beautiful version of "Blessed Assurance" from worship at Bethlehem We're a small congregation that focuses everything we've got on feeding our neighbors. Now with your help, we will work to house them too!Read more

title: santa save the sidebar
Description: Hey all, I need your help once again!I know it's right before Christmas, but we need your giving spirit and love of music to shine through right now. These last two years have been very hard on small venues like the Sidebar and not much relief was handed down from the legislation that was supposed to help. To keep Sidebar open and running, Feed The Scene Foundation Inc has been offered the opportunity to BUY THE SIDEBAR! Our plan is to have the non-profit purchase the business and the liquor license and run the bar as an open source non-profit so it will constantly endow itself for its own longevity. We would like to make a serious nod back to Mike Riley and his creation of the Charm City Art Space by making the Sidebar a place for everyone with a collective of promoters and other volunteers who care to help keep it running. All bartenders and staff will make livable wages and anything considered profit will be put back into the bar in terms of improvements or upgrades or guarantees for bands. No one on the Feed The Scene staff will be taking a salary from the bar. This is a labor of love.Now, you might be saying, "WAIT RACHEL HOW CAN I HELP?!?!?" HERE IS HOW!!! We need your donations. We are trying to raise $80,000 to cover the purchase, transfer of all legal property, liquor license, utilities, sound system, Etc ($50,000) and the remaining $30,000 is to cover a host of fixes the bar needs that may impede passing inspections we need for permits under new ownership. We will be keeping a public accounting of all funds that anyone can ask to see at any time. Anything raised over $80k will go to hopefully creating a usable greenroom on the lower level for bands and our drag shows. The best part is, because we are already a non-profit, all your donations are 100% tax deductible, so your giving helps you too!This whole endeavor is solely to make sure we don't lose the the only remaining small capacity, all-ages venue with a liquor license left in the city. This venue means so much to our local and national music community and we hope that even if you can't spare a dollar, that you can amplify the signal.Thank you so much,Rachel Taft, Kayleigh Lydick, Bobbie Dickerson, Bart Shiflett, Casey Severn, Nika Watkins, Jamie Schubert-Reitz and Feed The Scene Foundation Inc.Read more

title: rebuilding catnip acres clinic
Description: Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money to benefit Catnip Acres Inc, and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.This morning at 5:20 am I got the dreaded phone call. The entire clinic burned down. All medications: gone. Equipment: gone. Traps: gone. We lost everything. Luckily, the only silver lining in this, no pets were inside at the time of the fire (thank god!!).We have had obstacles before…but none like this. We are devastated and in shock. Carol has spent the last 35 years caring for the cats and dogs in Greene County. She has spayed/neutered over 50,000 cats and has found well over 50,000 cats homes. Carol does so much for this community and now we need more help than ever before to get our spay/neuter clinics, our TNR program, and our surgery clinics back up and running. We won’t give up this fight! Animals are our whole life and to watch every asset that helps us facilitate those animals burn up is heart wrenching.Please help us continue to help the animals in our community. We always have so much support from everyone, and we cannot thank you enough for any and all help.Read more

title: pzhfg

title: buzzcut bill
Description: Hi! My name is Billie Hughes and I am SHAVING MY HEAD!!I am a disability support worker from Port Macquarie and I have been inspired to start a small fundraiser to contribute to and raise awareness for a cause that is near and dear to my heart.Hastings Little Wishes is a foundation that consists of passionate group of local volunteers based in the Port Macquarie LGA with the purpose of granting wishes to children 17 and under that are living with serious illness. We believe that the families dealing with these terrible circumstances need a helping hand and the children deserve something to smile about.They aim to provide much needed resources such as mobility equipment, financial relief from bills, accommodation for medical appointments out of area, family holidays, toys, learning devices and so much more.Shaving my head has always been something I have wanted to do, but committing to it was terrifying especially due to the stigma that long, beautiful hair is linked with femininity and beauty. I not only want to support Hastings Little Wishes, but support those women who do not get to choose losing their hair, and prove the beauty and power of a woman is not defined by their external looks or the features they behold.I will be shaving my head at 3pm on Sunday the 30th January at the WaveBowl Terrace. I will be down there from around 2pm enjoying a few games of bowls, as well as having a few bevvys and some food.Each donation on the day will also put you in the draw to win a luxury hamper that has been put together and donated by Barambola wines.I hope you choose to support this great cause, and hopefully see you on the 30th!Read more

title: sidewalk school shelters fundraiser
Description: Felicia Rangel-Samponaro and Victor Cavazos, founders and directors of The Sidewalk School, have partnered with several other American and Mexican NGO's, to build two migrant shelters in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico. As we speak, over two thousand people including pregnant women, unaccompanied minors, medically fragile individuals, and families are living in tents or under tarps in a downtown plaza without proper sanitation, security, or access to critical services. Every day, new asylum seekers arrive at a plaza that can’t support any additional people. These precarious living conditions for asylum seekers exacerbate this humanitarian crisis and expose them to daily kidnappings, violence, extortion, and the elements (temperatures range from 30 degrees to 112 degrees Fahrenheit).The Sidewalk School is working around the clock to care for the migrants living under these terrible conditions and is committed to getting as many people into shelters as soon as possible. This fundraiser is for the funds needed to complete construction. As Felicia stated in the video, The Sidewalk School is focused on caring for the most vulnerable groups in Reynosa, including black asylum seekers, children, and families. No donation is too small. Your help is so appreciated and needed.The Sidewalk School WebsitePlease see the links below for more information:Articles:https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2021-12-27/the-woman-defending-black-lives-on-the-borderhttps://www.latimes.com/podcasts/story/2022-01-21/the-times-podcast-black-migrants-us-mexico-border PODCAST FROM LA TIMEShttps://myrgv.com/local-news/2022/01/07/work-begins-to-convert-reynosa-baseball-field-into-migrant-camp/https://myrgv.com/local-news/2022/01/04/pastor-ngo-ink-contract-for-new-migrant-shelter-in-reynosa/.Read more

title: helping the waukesha xtreme dance team dancers
Description: I'm raising money to benefit Waukesha Xtreme Dance Team Ltd, and any donation will help make an impact. title: please help nalla deliver her babies
Description: KC Emergency! My name is Nalla, and I am a two-year-old female cat.  I was having my third litter of kittens when my first two kittens were delivered stillborn, and I was having trouble delivering my other two. Unfortunately, one was pulled from me and did not make it. I'm in distress and on my way to the hospital, hoping to survive. Please help get me the medical care that I need!Thank you so much to everyone who steps forward in a crisis to help us deliver emergent care to our kitties!Read more

title: tap water challenge 20212022

title: open up the SMN art gallery
Description: The student art gallery at Shawnee Mission North (SMN) High School, the Brantman Art Gallery, is 42 years old and showing its age. The lighting is poor and the wall materials are deteriorating. Most importantly, with a closed-off entrance to the Gallery, students are unable to see the art when they walk by. In fact, some SMN students don't even know there's a gallery in the school. We want to change that!We are grateful to the Shawnee Mission School District and a local contractor for donating their services to fix the interior needs. But to create a modern Gallery for SMN students, we want to OPEN UP the gallery with a glass entry wall so everyone can see the art! The district cannot cover the cost of the new glass wall and with the interior updates starting over Spring Break, we only have until February 28th to raise $12,000 to bring a fresh, new look to the Gallery. Every dollar donated will go directly to the purchase of this glass wall and donors will be recognized on a plaque near the Art Gallery.With the 100th year anniversary of Shawnee Mission North this year, please make a donation TODAY to ensure the North community has an art gallery they can be proud of!——About the GalleryFor the students and teachers of Shawnee Mission North High School, the Brantman Art Gallery has been a staple of the art department for over 40 years. Serving both students and the broader community, the Gallery provides a space for students and community artists to present their work in a proper environment.It provides for North’s art students what gymnasiums and theaters offer for other students.The first of its kind, the Gallery opened in 1980 with overwhelming support from the community.The Patrons Art Gallery, Inc, a 501(c)(3) organization, was formed with a Board of Directors to support the programming and fundraising needs of the space. The Board, comprised of community volunteers and North teachers, has continued to support the Gallery through the years.The Board has engaged many professional artists who have shown at the gallery and worked alongside students in their classrooms.In addition to regular exhibits, the gallery has purchased over 50 pieces of art from students to form a permanent collection.To support the art department, the Gallery has funded scholarships for over 30 North students to attend summer art enrichment classes at the KC Art Institute. Annually, the Gallery funds opportunities for students to visit the Nelson-Atkins Art Museum exhibits—some students attending a museum for the first time.The Board is proud to continue providing enrichment opportunities and support for the artistic growth of Shawnee Mission North art students.Read more

title: bell creek ptso annual donation drive 2122

title: skydive for pupils with pmld at palmerston school
town: Liverpool, North West England, United Kingdom
Description: Jessica is a phenomenal young lady.  She is braving this fantastic feat on 20th March 2022 to raise money for our local SEN school Palmerston School to benefit profound and multiple learning disabled pupils. Here's a quick introduction for those who don't know Jessica.Jessica is a young lady who wants to mark turning 18 in a unique way. Jessica was born with Down syndrome and associated learning and physical disabilities and has already led an awe-inspiring life. She survived open-heart surgery as a newborn to correct three large holes which were threatening her life, and at the age of 4, she developed a heart block and was fitted with a pacemaker to keep her heart beating. She has battled the pressures of mainstream life with a huge smile, and she is a successful model, actress and singer/songwriter.She has been close to death on more than one occasion, and she doesn't take the gift of life for granted. Jessica has always had a "get-up and grab life" attitude, so when she first said she wanted to do a skydive, no one was surprised at all!Whilst researching making her dream a reality, it was quickly apparent that there are not many (if any at all) young ladies with Down syndrome in the UK who have ever done a skydive. For this reason, she has chosen the date of 20th March, which is the day before World Down Syndrome Day, observed internationally on 21st March every year.Jessica plans to raise as many funds as possible for profound and multiple learning disabled (PMLD) pupils at the fantastic secondary school Palmerston School in Liverpool.  In the PMLD cohort, students are aged 11 to 19, and most students are wheelchair users. They are largely non-verbal, have limited mobility to access their environment and have significant medical needs. The funds raised will be used for essential equipment to be used in class to enrich the school experience for pupils with PMLD, helping pupils access lessons and explore the world around them, including new technology, improving therapies, trips out, interactive toys.Jessica's Mum, Nicola, is an Additional Needs Support Assistant in Palmerston School, and Jessica has always taken an interest in the students she supports. Jessica has visited pupils in Palmerston School many times and has always left feeling so inspired by the joy and happiness in classes that she too wanted to do something to bring smiles and help make life opportunites more accessible.Please help Jessica achieve this lifetime dream and deliver some much-needed funding for our friends in the PMLD cohort of Palmerston School. You can make a difference by donating today to THE FRIENDS OF PALMERSTON SCHOOL.Read more

title: new isolation crates
Description: We have exciting news! We have been working on converting our 400 square foot garage into a new cat room for special needs, medical, and isolation. This conversion will add 400 feet of life-saving space to our rescue. Previously only Hercules and one or two others would occupy this area, and it was unfinished and tough to clean. We had a fantastic adopter/supporter donate the supplies and his company's time and labor to put in new flooring. Thank you so much Nate We will be painting the space ourselves over the next couple of days . The final step will be adding new crates, allowing us to house and rescue more special needs and medical rescues. Taking our isolation crates from 3 to 12 Read more

title: a fundraiser for yess in memory of mich
Description: If you're seeing this, you probably had a cozy place in the heart of our mum, Michelle (aka, Mich). You may or may not know it, but she was a fierce annual contributor to several Canadian foundations supporting a variety of causes - animal sanctuaries, homeless shelters, food banks and everything in between.We believe that it would be her wish to continue giving this one last time --so instead of flowers, cards or gifts, we ask that you please show your love for Mich by making a contribution to our fundraiser for YESS (Youth Empowerment & Social Services).YESS provides many incredible services to traumatized youth aged 15-24 in the Edmonton area and provides them with resources for the real world. You can read their annual report for the past 2 years at THIS LINK to get an idea of why we chose to support them in this effort. Thank you.Andrew, Heather & BrianRead more

title: ukeyb help jack get home
Description: Jack is a 5 month old puppy with spinabifida. He was surrendered to us when his breeder no longer wanted to care for him and his special needs. Jack cannot walk on his back legs, nor can he express his own bowels. Despite his disabilities, Jack is the spiciest, silliest and most affectionate puppy you could ever ask for. He loves other dogs, being pushed around in a stroller on long walks and playing tug with his foster siblings.In our rescue, most puppies get adopted quickly, however, because Jack is specific medical needs, finding him a home that is able to and WANTS to care for him the way he needs to be cared for has been a challenge. Thankfully, we have finally found a family that wants to welcome Jack into their home. They live in Oregon, but they have experience with dogs just like Jack and are SO excited to make him a part of their family. He will have all of his needs cared for and some doggy siblings to play with! Due to Jacks breed and special needs, he cannot fly. For the same reason, we do not want to put Jack in a transport with a company. It is in Jacks best interest that he be personally chauffeured by his foster mom across the country to meet his new family. We are raising money to cover the cost of the hotel stays, car rental and flight back for foster mom. Shes already taking time to ensure that Jack has the most comfortable journey, we dont want her to have to worry about the financial expenses as well, so we, the rescue, will be covering them.Please help Jack get home! Read more

title: mike aiello memorial fund
Description: Please join the Aiello family during this tragic loss of our Husband, Father, Son, Brother and Friend; Michael John Aiello.In lieu of flowers we would like to take this opportunity to honor one of our fathers biggest passions, Water Mission. Please use the GoFundMe if you wish to contribute.Love,The Aiello FamilyWater Mission:Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money to benefit Water Mission (Water Mission), and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.More information about Water Mission (Water Mission): The Water Mission™ organization is a Christian engineering nonprofit that designs, builds, and implements safe Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) solutions for people in developing countries and disaster areas. Since 2001, Water Mission has used innovative technology and engineering expertise to provide access to safe water for nearly 7 million people in 57 countries. Water Mission has over 400 staff members working in its headquarters and around the world in permanent country programs located in Africa, Asia, North, South, and Central America, and the Caribbean. To learn more, visit watermission.org. Water Mission's mission is to honor God by developing, implementing, and sharing best-in-class safe water solutions that transform as many lives as possible, as quickly as possible.Read more

title: help fund noodles emergency surgery
Description: Hi! I'm Noodles. I'm a 1 year old Great Dane. I found myself being surrendered to Buffalo Cares after an injury to my tail. I've had not one but two tail amputations over the last month. The second surgery was successful and I was almost done healing. I was hoping I was ready to find my forever family! On Friday I started started to not feel well, my foster mom took me to the Cheektowaga Emergency Vet where they did X-rays and found out I had a blockage. I had life saving emergency surgery overnight on 1/23 and will stay at the ER vet till I am healthy enough to go back home with my foster family. Please help us cover the cost of Noodles most recent surgery, the lower end of her vet bill is close to $5,000.More information about Buffalo CARES Animal Rescue: Buffalo C.A.R.E.S. Animal Rescue is an all breed, volunteer driven, 501(c)(3) non- profit organization dedicated primarily, but not limited to, the facilitation of placement of homeless animals the Buffalo, NY & surrounding area shelters/animal control facilities. We provide safe foster homes, needed veterinary care, balanced training, socialization and support to develop a well adjusted family companion.Read more

title: in memory of michael b pavone
Description: In lieu of flowers or cards, the Pavone family would be honored if you would contribute in memory of Michael Pavone to the JC Recovery House, a non-profit Christian rehabilitation center for men & women.As many of you may know, Michael had been fighting the horrific disease of addiction. He fought it with everything he had. He found the greatest support while being at the JC Recovery House in Hollywood Florida. JCRH was the one place where he found the most peace, love, strength, and support, and was led to accept Jesus Christ as his Savior and Lord.We are forever grateful to Stevie B. and the rest of his crew there for giving him loving structured guidance and encouragement.This organization supports both men and women who have the desire to recover and reclaim their life. Your contribution could mean so much to someone else’s life.The following link will allow you to make a tax deductible donation to help others caught in the grip of this disease. Thank you for your support.Read more
